Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gerip57
Reviews.Content: We [myself,daughter and grandaughter]stayed at Olimpia pre-cruise april7 and post cruise april15. We had the same triple room,107 both times. the room was lovely,overlooking garden with all the amenities needed. Great shower,plenty of soft towels,etc. the hotel staff, as reported by many reviewers,were so pleasant and helpful at all times.Robert has great sense of humor. location was very good,close to vaporetto and buses. we had a little problem with steps on bridge, but this is so for most of venice. also, there is a great little restaurant[recommended by Robert] around the corner, the Venexiana-ate there twice. the neighborhood,Santa Croce, was interesting to explore. there is the beautiful church, the Frari, within walking distance. I would definitely recommend this lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dalrobin
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11.45am and our room was ready which was a great start. We stayed in the building across the garden and our room was wonderful. It was spacious and decorated to such a high standard that we were very impressed. The bathroom was big too, especially the shower, which is so unusual in a budget hotel. Also the wardrobe and drawer space was much more than we needed, again unusual. The reception staff were all so friendly and helpful and the map they gave us was very useful as it had a suggested walking route around the city which took in all you needed to see and prevented us from getting lost. The breakfast room was plenty big enough and prettily decorated and the food was excellent too. We ate in two nearby restaurants at night which were the Trattoria da Biasini and the Rio Novo. Both had great food and were not expensive in the slightest. The house red wine at 12 euros a litre was superb. If you are arriving at Marco Polo airport then the ATVO shuttle bus is the best way to get to the hotel. The tickets are 5euros for a single or 9 return and they ran exactly on time and only took 15 minutes. As people have said before, the hotel is visible from Piazzale Roma where the bus drops you off, so you can't get lost and it only takes 5 minutes. We thoroughly enjoyed Venice and the Olimpia played a big part in that.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !”
Reviews.Author: zory_1977
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great quality, great service, great location. Hotel is decorated in traditional Venetian style with modern friendly approach to service and quality. All the hotel staff were friendly, helpful and very professional. The breakfast buffet was excellent. Great location /especially if you are taking the bus from the airport/. Hotel is visible from the Piazzale Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CTacitus
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned about the proximity to Piazzale Roma, and asked to switch to a room on the far side of the hotel. It was spacious and attractively furnished. Lovely glass chandelier. And no street noise at all. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The location is very good. The vap stop is only 5 minutes away and the train station about a ten to fifteen-minute walk. We've stayed closer to San Marco in the past, but who would complain about a ride down the Grand Canal every morning to get to the attractions at the east end of Venice? The concierge recommended a good, inexpensive restaurant near by, Hosteria Venexiana (?).

Reviews.Title: “Great quality, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: DrunkLove
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lot cheaper than others in Venice I looked at, and I was of course unsure of what the quality would be like, but I needn't have worried. The hotel boasts a quirky old-style decor (with the smallest lift I've ever seen!) but a modern friendly approach to service and quality. From the very start of our stay, all the hotel staff, from the receptionist to the concierge to the kitchen staff, were obliging and very professional. Robert G, one of the staff there, deserves particular mention for being funny and cheerful and very helpful in giving us directions on how to get trains to Verona. The breakfast was excellent - a feast of fruit, cereals, eggs, yoghurt, etc - all washed down with the amazing Italian coffee that Venice seems to excel at. Useful WiFi throughout the hotel for checking emails or downloading maps. Also great location, especially if you are taking the bus from the airport, as the hotel is literally visible from the car park (Piazzale Roma) where the bus drops you off. This was very useful when we were scrambling to catch our bus back to the airport! Can't really think of any significant faults. Certainly a good base for any stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Kateryna M
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and loved every moment of it! the room was exceptionally clean and spacious, the view out of the windows was to the inner yard with nice flowers and birds singing. the breakfast is really great and offers quite a variety, besides, nice coffee from a coffee maker. The staff is worth the highest grade, and we actually voted with the help of "cordiality cards" from the breakfast room)) Just 30 minutes by vaporetto to san marko and around 50 minuted by feet back to the hotel, even being there for the first time. Will definitely come again

Reviews.Title: “5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Gage777
Reviews.Content: We rounded off our Italian holiday at Venice. We could not have ended our trip any better than staying at the BW Hotel Olimpia. The hotel was the best hotel of our holiday. The room was spacious, had all the facilities and very stylish. The hotel is easily accessible and is close to the bus station. The breakfast was very enjoyable and delicious and the friendly staff were only to happy to help with any of our requests. The hotel also provides many services free of charge which made our stay just that much better. The hotel is well worth the price and we would recommend this hotel to anybody traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value for money and convenient location if you just want to park and be at your hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaynew1
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spotless and although quite small had all you needed for a short stay. I found the bed very uncomfortable but nearly always have this problem where ever I stay so could be too fussy! All of the hotel staff were extremely helpful and did their best for us at all times especially Robert G who really made our stay. Main plus point was the great breakfast biggest moan was cold showers in the morning. Tip is either to get up very early and shower or take it early evening when it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holly M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a really nice surprise. We were hesitant because of its proximity to the Train Station and the parking and bus transportation hub in Venice. But, we were also trying to stay near those areas while trying to avoid all of the noise and madness. This hotel was just the ticket. It is along a small canal within a 10 minute walk to the train, or the shuttle stop from the airport. It's helpful to note that there is a shuttle (for approximately $6) leaving from the airport every half hour or so which travels to the Venice transportation hub. Taking a water taxi can be incredibly expensive. The hotel is small, but just lovely, with beautiful gardens. The included breakfast is huge and very well maintained. The staff is incredibly helpful. If you travel during the off-season, as we did in March, the rates are very reasonable. Within easy walking distance there are few excellent neighborhood restaurants. We will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Third Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jean43
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to the Olimpia and as ever it was a great stay. it is so convenient for the airport buses and the vaporettas. The staff are really friendly and helpful especially Robert G. who has such a great sense of humour along with great knowledge. We always look forward to his witty charm! The breakfast is really delicious with lots of choice. We found a lovely restaurant in nearby Salizzada san Pantalon called Ae Cravate. The food is excellent at a reasonable price. It's probably best to book though on our second visit at 7pm we had no trouble in getting a table. (They are closed on a Tuesday.) We look forward to our next visit to the Olimpia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so easy to find and get to - no lugging our luggage across the city for us!”
Reviews.Author: Suzxq
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. Quirky and very Venetian. Breakfast was just great, staff all very friendly and helpful and it's in the perfect location, straight off the bus, drop your bags and head out to explore the city. My only small complaint was the next-to-useless hairdryer - as much as they do provide one, if you actually wish to dry your hair I'd recommend taking your own dryer, otherwise you'll never get out the room. But very worth the money - we would definitely book again next time we go to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 Star Hotel We Found In Italy”
Reviews.Author: TeamTam
Reviews.Content: Our room at Hotel Olimpia was fantastic - very elegant and fitting for Venice, but yet modern. It wasn't huge, but it has a few unexpected luxuries for a 3-star hotel including a rainwater shower head. No kettle though, but this appears to be standard for Italy. Breakfast was exceptional. There was good variety, and my wife who is gluten-free had plenty to eat while often even at 4 star hotels she will go hungry. The location was good - right near the bus terminal and within walking distance of the train station. However, be prepared for some stairs going over bridges no matter which hotel in Venice you stay at unless you get a private gondola. My only complaint with the hotel itself was the wifi which did not work from our room but did work fine from the lobby. The hotel staff tried to help and informed me a technician worked on the wireless network the week prior to my stay, which I suppose is about the level of technical support to be expected from a typical hotel worker. Overall, the service was great, and often came with a sense humour which we appreciated. We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Olimpia, and our overall experience here was better than most 3 or 4 star hotels we stayed at on this France/Italy trip. For a 3-star property, we are happy to give this hotel a Trip Advisor "5".

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, gorgeous, convenient”
Reviews.Author: IPLady
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre-cruise based on others recommendations. Didn't disappoint in any way. EXCELLENT breakfast, pretty and spacious room, great hot water, helpful staff and loved relaxing in the garden at night after wandering all day. Vaparetto stop around the corner and only two flights of stairs from where bus dropped us off. Great place in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bagin1981
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, romantic atmosphere, all the furniture in the entire hotel is done in one style. Very varied breakfast, osobeeno against 3-star hotel in Milan and Florence, which Ivisited in the same trip. The location is very successful, and the number of buses andriver trams, walking distance to Piazza San Marco, 30 minutes stroll. Prior to the train station 10 minutes. walk or 1 stop on river tram.

Reviews.Title: “Good location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Siva K
Reviews.Content: Located close to bus station need to take 2 bridges to get here from the train station. Everything is close by in venice, front-desk person was super nice and very talkative.. Have to climb 4 floors to go our room, luckily the doorman helped us with the luggages. Stayed here one night and they stored our luggage for free.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, clean, tidy and well decorated with very friendly and helpful staff. This was our third visit to Venice and it was the best value for money hotel we have experienced, we will definately return. Convenient location for both bus and train stations

Reviews.Title: “Near train station”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekers
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for good home base near train station this is it. Since we had been to Venice on a couple other occassions and this visit was for an MSC Cruise departing Venice. We opted for convenience. Staff was very friendly and free breakfast was very nice. Rooms do need to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel - Easy to get to.”
Reviews.Author: xenagurl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November 2011, after taking the train from Rome. Friendly staff, clean, nicely decorated, good breakfast, and great location. All in all lovely! When you come out of the train station I took the long route (I hear you can skip a bridge) but you go right. Cross a large bridge, arrive in the area with the buses. Go towards the vendors selling Venetian wares, walk through that area, go right, cross the larger or the two bridges and make another right. It's right past the hotel Arlecchino. Ask "Picasso" to draw you a map of local restaurants that you should try :) It would be nice if you could turn the little blue light off at night (where the key goes to turn the main lights on in the room) Other than that, no real issues.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: WHALER123
Reviews.Content: Six of us were booked to stay at the Arlecchino Hotel, however on arriving we were surprised to find a note on the entrance door advising all patrons to please report to the reception of the Hotel Olimpia 20 metres down the road. Oh Dear, was our first thought! However we were welcomed at reception, and told that the Arlecchino was closed for renovation, and that we`d been given an upgrade to the Olimpia! From the moment we walked through the door we were made to feel very welcome, all the staff were freindly and polite, the rooms were a touch on the small side but were very clean and had a lovely charm about them with typical Venetian decor,breakfast was a relaxed informal affair being continental buffet style, with plenty of choice of cereals cold meats, fruits and cheeses, again the dining area clean and comfortable. Our room overlooked the canal and on to the bus station, not the best but our freinds room had a lovely room overlooking the pretty Italian garden at the back. This hotel is excellently placed for arrivals from water taxis, trains or busses. Being a 5 - 10 walk from each. The main St Marks square is a very enjoyable and picturesque 15 - 20 minute walk away, and ther are numerous shops, bars and resaurants within a couple of minutes. I must say a special thankyou to Robert ( the Welsh Italian) on reception, he was very helful advising us where to eat ( we had the best meal ever in Hostaria Venexiana). He was always smiling and ready to share a joke. I`m sure we`ll return to Venice and would happily return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: jr0000
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for two nights (Christmas eve, and Christmas night) with wife and three kids. Hotel was perfect. We had two rooms, a double and triple. Rooms weren't huge, but comfortable, and the triple room was a double and single combined. Rooms were clean, and hotel was very quiet. Staff was helpful when asked. Breakfast was great. A short walk to the water taxi stop, and very convenient to the bus depot. Would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: anfdiva25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect launching point for exploring Venice. It is extremely convenient to the Train Station, Bus Station, and the Cruise Port (the People Mover located next to the Bus Station, takes you straight to the Cruise Port for 1 Euro). We had a lot of heavy luggage, so the location was absolutely perfect. You can see the hotel's sign from the Bus Station, and then you just have to walk over two small bridges to get there. The hotel's location serves as an easy jumping off point for exploring Venice. The vaporetto station (water bus) is a two minute walk, and one of the lines there takes you straight down the grand canal. It was also quite easy to explore Venice by foot from the hotel. The hotel offers maps of Venice with a suggested route outlined in red, in reality though, maps in general are kind of difficult to use in Venice. It is easier to just follow the posted signs that with guide you to the major locations (like St. Mark's Square or the Bus Station). Our room was in the separate section of the hotel. It's a couple doorways down from the main hotel where the front desk is located. You need a couple different keys to get into this section of the hotel, and it seems like some of the floors contain regular apartments, not just hotel rooms. There isn't an elevator in this section, and you have to climb 3-flights of stairs, but we didn't find it to be a problem. Our room was very nice. We had a large window that overlooked the canal. The decor was very period, think Louis XIV, but it was charming and I loved it! Nothing seemed dated to me. The bathroom was nicely appointed as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: worldbeaches
Reviews.Content: We loved out stay! So close from train station did not need water taxi, a good ten minute walk with too much luggage! My fault! Lots of steps but not terrible. Emailed ahead of time with request for room with a view and they had us on top floor which was very safe, we even had our window open at night. Do not recommend restaurant next door, not the best, walk further into Venice, go to Ala Madonna , it's excellent the food was amazing. Service at hotel was nice. They do need more than one computer. But do have free Wi Fi so using Skype on my IPhone was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: traveling42_11
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this Best Western Hotel. Great location for Cruiser...close to COOP stores for those last minute items before your cruise. Beautiful rooms, great breakfast, the Front Desk service "THE BEST", very accommodating with holding luggage etcâ€¦ ask them for restaurant suggestions. When I return to Venice â€¦ no question, I will return to this Hotelâ€¦ Just a wonderful 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awaiting your arrival.”
Reviews.Author: medevac3
Reviews.Content: If you are cruising, this a great location. We walked from cruise terminal to Piaza Roma. The hotel is visible from the Piaza. You can get to the airport by bus, cab, or water taxi practically from the front door. The room was small but had a nice view. We left the window and shutters open and it still was not too noisy, although there is activity going on almost all night. Small but usable elevator, which you don't always get. The location and ease of travel made it worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and GREAT Value.”
Reviews.Author: Cavalry S
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel within walking distance of the train station and cruise terminal. About a 15 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. 5 minute walk to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Beautiful Garden”
Reviews.Author: travellinglane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this inn September 2011 on our first European vacation - and were wowed. It is a charming facility with a beautiful garden that you can view from the patio while eating an amazing breakfast! The location was excellent - just a very short way to Piazalle Roma as well as the shuttle to the cruise terminal. We arrived a few days early for a cruise and this hotel was an excellent starting point to visit all of Venice. The next time we go (and we will go again!), we are likely to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise overnight”
Reviews.Author: CalUrsus
Reviews.Content: This was a great find at the end of a long day of cramped multiple low-cost European flights. Be aware Piazzale Roma has some construction so getting off it is a little harder. But this hotel is just a block below the square and the people mover to the cruises, and yet quiet and full of character for a super price in low season. The evening welcome from RIchard was very warm, the other staff equally friendly, nice breakfast buffet and servers, beautiful garden out back. Rooms and beds were clean and comfortable and authentic--you know you're in Venice. Only minus points to note, the walls are a little thin, and the tiny elevator gets a bit crowded with check out baggage and crowded for departure, but the staff stays mellow. (Hey it's Venice--you're lucky they have an elevator) Definitely a keeper for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Venice just off the Grand Canal...”
Reviews.Author: ecbmdpsych
Reviews.Content: It's convenient to everything... No more than a 5-minute walk and no need to take any water vehicles to and from these places: Venice Cruise ship terminal, People Mover trams, Piazzale Roma, Venezia Santa Lucia Train Station, Express bus to Venice Airport, Grand Canal, Vaporetto Station, Condola Station, restaurants, shops, etc..The exterior is certainly not impressive, just a simple brick building that you can see standing in the center of Piazzale Roma. Once you walk in the lobby is certainly not impressive. It was a bit small but clean inside. The staff greeted you cordially and they were pleasant and helpful. The elevator can only fit 1 person and a luggage but the stairs are accessible though somewhat narrow but two people can still pass one another. Despite all these, the rest of the hotel is homey and welcoming. The dining room has plenty of tables and they serve a very good variety of breakfast buffet style food from different kinds of bread to several choices of cold cuts, hard boiled eggs, cheeses, fruits, fresh juices, hot beverages, cereals, yogurt, etc. but no hot breakfast items. Nonetheless, I think the number of continental breakfast items more than compensated for the absence of the hot items. This hotel also has an eye pleasing and pretty garden in the backyard that is so relaxing because it is protected from the sight of people and water vehicles. If you are like us who assumed that the rooms are a reflection of the simple non-pretentious facade of this hotel, I'm sorry to say you are wrong. Wait till you see the rooms in the hotel. Just take a look at the pictures of room 109 and the pictures will do all the talking.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Liz130
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a pre-cruise visit in Venice. Took the bus from the airport - and getting to the hotel was fairly simple - which is a big plus in Venice. Had to wait a short time for the room to be ready - but it was worth the wait! Beautiful room overlooking the back garden with a modern bath. Just delightful. I can't say enough nice things about Serena at the front desk who made our visit even better with suggestions and directions. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, safe, and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: melancholy77
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel in Venice to stay for a few nights during our 2 week Europe trip after much last minute research. Priorities were convenient location from our dropoff point, clean/safe, and reasonable pricing. Hotel Olimpia provided these and much more. We took the shuttle from the airport to Piazzale Roma. When you get off the bus, you pretty much look southeast and can see the hotel which is about a 3 minute walk with only two tiny bridges to cross with luggage. Check-in was efficient and we were shown up to our room by the bellhop. We booked on a third party travel website (expedia/orbitz) and were annexed. Reading other reviews, it seems like this may be the case. The annex is next door. There are some stairs and a dimly lit passageway which transiently smelled like garbage, but otherwise our room in the annex seemed safe, relatively quiet, and clean. Room was spacious and clean. We couldn't open our minisafe door and did not request to have it fixed. Heater worked well. Showers and bathroom were clean and nice enough with decent hot water and water pressure. Wi-fi in our room was extremely spotty, but usable enough to get by. Pillows and beds seemed harder than most we'd encountered in Europe, but otherwise our room was fairly quiet. Service was a strong point of the hotel. We had to change our travel plans and make special accommodations including staying an additional night, allowing me to bring a tray of breakfast and hot water up to the room as well as some adjusted housemaid service-- they were extremely understanding and cooperative. English was fairly good at the front desk and service was good despite some mild crowds of people even in the off-season. Serena at the front desk was extremely accommodating and made the hotel feel like our home in Venice for the days we stayed there! Other points - breakfast is quite decent with a wide range of meats/cheeses, cereal, breads, fruits, and great coffee. The garden would have been nice to have breakfast if the weather were warmer. The waitress was efficient, polite, and very helpful. Location-wise, it is near several shops for pizza, kebabs, sandwiches, snacks and easily with decent walking distance of the major sights. While it is not super close to St Marks, the Rialto bridge, or the Accademia, I preferred staying a bit farther away from those places as part of the fun of Venice is wandering around a place where you can't really get too lost. I can't say if this hotel is super busy during the high season given its proximity to the people mover and cruise ships, but hopefully it is less crowded than the hotels near St Marks. Regardless, due to the service they provided, we would certainly consider staying here again for a trip to Venice. Thank you again Serena!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gilda
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to get to this hotel from the Piazzale Roma. Just bear to the right and cross one bridge and you're there. It was very clean, the BF was wonderful and plentiful, the location was great, and the front desk service was fantastic. I went on a cruise (RT from Venice) and I forgot my phone in the room and wrote them about it, and when I came back to Venice, my phone was nicely wrapped and waiting for me in the front desk. Need I say more about honesty? You can take the bus (ATVO) from the airport for 5 euros, and then when you go to the cruise terminal you can take the people mover in the PR for 1 euro; this will drop you off at about a 15 minute walk to the main terminal and there are free shuttles that will take you to the ship. We opted to just go walking and basically got there sooner, but we didn't have heavy luggage either. Anyway, I highly recommend this hotel especially if you are going on a cruise. Venice is small and you will be walking distance to everything. Thank you for reading this. G.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travel-len321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days following a cruise. We took the PeopleMover from Marritima (the cruise ship terminal) to Piazzale Roma, and the hotel was only about a block away. The room was small by US standards, but probably average for Europe. It was comfortably furnished, clean and quiet. Our room overlooked a small canal in front of the hotel, and there was a beautiful garden in the back of the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The daily breakfast was good, and the staff diligently restocked items that were running low. The location was not only convenient to the PeopleMover, but also a short walk to the Vaporetto stop (from which we traveled to St. Mark's square, Murano and Burano on different occasions), and to the train station (from which we did a day trip to Florence). Upon departure we were just a short walk back to Piazzale Roma to catch the ATVO express bus to the airport. In a town that is not very luggage friendly, this location helped minimize the handling of same. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pre-cruise hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kcl491
Reviews.Content: Just to echo other reviewers, this is an absolutely excellent hotel if you are embarking on a cruise from the Venice port. There are four or five other hotels at or near the Piazzale Roma, but the BW Olimpia is at least $50/night less expensive (by my research for our dates). We stayed two nights pre-cruise in order to explore the city. There are quite a number of nice restaurants within walking distance and the train station has a Marche type dining area which we used for lunch one day. A COOP supermarket opposite the vaporetto stations at the Piazzale is available for all your last minute purchases. And you can easily walk to the People Mover to get over to the port. From the port stop it is about a 5 minute walk to your ship terminal. We were assigned a two room "suite" on the 4th floor - a bedroom and a separate sitting room. Plenty of closet space with an in-room safe. The bathroom was larger than most we've seen in Europe and the breakfast was ample. Front desk service was great. Our only complaint is that there were no screens on the windows. The weather was nice while we visited and we kept the windows open and had to squash some bugs that flew in. We would stay here again, cruise or no cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: AriesInMotion
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best choices one has if they are planning to stay in Venice. It is just few minutes away from Piazzale Roma (where the bus from the airport drops you) and very easy to find. You do not need to carry your luggage around the city and get lost in the narrow streets. Perfect location. Moreover, when you are travelling in Venice you can either walk from here (everything is in a decent distance if you are into walking). You can also take the vaporetto from few mins away from the hotel in case you are not the sporty type and it will lead you to any point of interest on the island. Location is just one of the nice things about the hotel. We really liked it, felt warm and cozy. On the window you could see the gondolas in the canal, the furniture is very old and fancy, giving you a perfect feel of Venice. Food is good, you get free wireless, nice staff, etc. Breakfast is nice and you can find great places to eat in a few minutes walk from the hotel. We had a great time every evening, I can mention Osterria Venexiana, Osteria Ae Cravate or Trattoria Le Burchielle as 3 of the nice places near by. All in all, a great place, definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: 2Corinthians96
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to find amidst all the other choices. Once we landed at the airport, we hopped on Bus 5 and were at Piazzale Roma in 20 minutes. The hotel was very easy to find and an easy walk even pulling luggage. Once checked in, we found everything within walking distance. As we were boarding a cruise ship within days, we also found the close proximity to the people mover very nice. Yes, our room was small but the bathroom was very large. We did have an issue with 2 mosquitos, but they were quickly taken care of (smashed). I don't know if the plug-ins they supply help. I came away most impressed by the desk clerks who helped me with any issues I had. Robert and Roberto were there anytime I needed anything. Great job!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulista1977
Reviews.Content: Good hotel: spacious rooms, located close to the railway and bus stations. A long walk to San Marco Square but plenty of sights on the way. Breakfast was excellent and staff, helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. But overpriced and let down by some of the staff”
Reviews.Author: Justme474
Reviews.Content: By sharing your experiences you're helping travellers make better choices and plan their dream trips. Thank you! This is a truly lovely hotel albeit seriously overpriced on some nights. Most staff were excellent but there were two who were rude to the extreme - a male receptionist and a breakfast waitress. I have never experienced such rudeness and arrogance in a hotel anywhere in the world before. Such a shame. This beautiful hotel deserves better. Oh, and we were bitten by mosquitoes. No one tells you that will happen in November and we only discovered the plug ins when we were checking the draws before check out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristikae
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Piazzale Roma, excellent breakfast. Free wi-fi in the lobby but the line to use this can get long in the morning. Tables outside right on the canal with no service charge to sit and relax. Hotel was very clean. I'd go back any time!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT, CLEAN, FRIENDLY and HELPFUL”
Reviews.Author: BarbBo
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Europe before so we werent accustomed to the high prices of hotels there, but ya gotta pay what ya gotta pay! This hotel could not have been better unless they hand carried our luggage to the airport for us. But they did come close...hahaha....The well appointed room was sparkling clean, (padded wallpaper too) the lobby had a nice bar, and a nice breakfast room. The staff was excellent excellent!!! They arranged for a cab to pick us up in the wee hours of the morning and help us carry our luggage over the canal bridge and take us to the airport. We REALLY APPRECIATED THAT!!! It's located on a side canal and close to lots of shopping in the northern area of Venice. Would sure stay there again! Elevator is waaaay small...only two normal size people can fit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in almost every way”
Reviews.Author: bigcanoe2
Reviews.Content: Generally the majority of reviews are spot on when it comes to this hotel. Yes, the location is very convenient (especially if you have lots of luggage to carry). Yes, the breakfast is very good. Yes, the staff is helpful and polite. Yes, the facility is neat and clean. Yes, our room was pretty. All in all a very wise choice to stay here while in Venice. HOWEVER...the room you are given is seems to be a result of how you book the hotel. We used Expedia. When we checked in the clerk said something to the effect that because we did so we would be in the annex. The annex has no elevator and we were on the 4th level. Kind of difficult for people with artificial knees. It was not an option to change because we booked through Expedia. Makes on wonder why ?

Reviews.Title: “A Venetian surprise”
Reviews.Author: LizzybeeYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the recommendation of other Trip Advisor reviews because it was close to the People Mover at Piazzale Roma. We were booked on a cruise but wanted to stay in Venice for a few days beforehand. We could not have made a better choice. The location was great, within walking distance of everything we wanted to see and also allowed us to see areas that we had not been able to access on our previous visit to Venice such as the Zattere, Santa Croce and the Dorsoduro. The hotel could not have been more welcoming and with a bottle of Prosecco as a special offer served elegantly in an ice bucket with linen and sparkling glasses we knew we were off to a great start. The rooms are charming with furniture in painted Venetian style and walls covered in brocade fabric and although not large have everything to make a stay comfortable and enjoyable. The breakfast room is charming and we were lucky enough to eat outside every morning in the delightful garden with butterflies and bird song. Impossible to believe we were so close to the hustle and bustle outside. The food was varied and fresh and replenished regularly with speedy service of coofee.We booked a room overlooking the canal and enjoyed opening the windows wide to see the porters loading baggage on water taxis, a distant view of the Grand Canal and several bridge spanning various canal branches. We will definitely stay there when we visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabbo8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at Hotel Olympia. Its location is great as very close to the train station although I didnt realise quite how close and actually caught the vaporetto to P. Roma when you could easily walk there. We were given a room in the back section of the hotel and it involved going up two flights of stairs which was a shame as I had made sure this hotel had a lift but that only services the front part of the hotel. I did ask to change rooms but there were none available that night. The hotel did offer to move us the next day but I declined as we were only there for two nights anyway and didnt want to have to repack again. We did have to wait awhile for our luggage and when the porter bought it to us I realised he was expecting a tip. Porter declined the change I offered him and told me he could give me change from 20euro - thought that was a bit cheeky. The room was very quaint. Had a bedroom with a queensize bed and a small loungeroom with a day bed. The bathroom was very small but it was all clean and tidy and comfortable. Breakfast was good. Mostly a choice of cereals, bread and pastries. We did eat the first night at the restaurant of the hotel and were very disappointed in the meal - tasteless and bland. Meal came to 52euros and I gave them 60euros and they never came back to offer me my change or the choice to tip - the meal certainly wasnt worthy of a tip at all - but I didnt complain. Hotel was generally very nice but not sure I would stay again - would prefer to try others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent for cruise departures.”
Reviews.Author: SueW35
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position close to Piazzale Roma, where the airport bus stops. You can see the hotel from the square and you only need to cross one bridge (a big plus point with luggage!) It is also an easy walk to the station and to the People Mover for cruise departures. Venice was extremely busy and it was good to be a little outside the main tourist areas around St Marks and Rialto, but still within walking distance. The Reception staff were very welcoming and helpful. Our room was spacious and comfortable with separate sitting area, modern bathroom and free Wi-Fi. Breakfast was fine and could be taken in the breakfast room or outside in the garden. Several good and reasonably priced restaurants in the neighbouring streets. Excellent value for money and we would definitely use this hotel again on future visits to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near the train station”
Reviews.Author: FR54
Reviews.Content: we ahve enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Olimpia which is very close to the train station and also close to the main boat station. Room was great and clean with a very nice and weel decorated bathroom with enough space to be comfortable. The breakfast room was nice and Ok but with the great option of having your breakfast outside in the the calm and relaxing graden which gives a totally different view of the place and gets you ready for a great walk through the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: plstrobel
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, cold air conditioning, warm and friendly staff, and only two bridges from train station and one bridge from Water busses and Piazzaie Roma. They have tables with an awning outside their front door so you can sit and have some wine and enjoy Venice. A good restaurant is right next door and the staff will tell which ones in the area to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Olimpia”
Reviews.Author: GrammyPam
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the Hotel Olimpia while visiting Venice. We found it conveniently located for our needs. When we arrived in Venice, we were able to take a bus from the airport to the Piazzale Roma and then walked to the hotel. We were also able to walk to the train station for our departure. Our room was nicely decorated, clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent and we enjoyed dining in the garden. The gentleman at the desk when we arrived late in the afternoon was welcoming and very helpful. We were pleased with our stay in the Hotel Olimpia.

Reviews.Title: “thank you for your 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: carol w
Reviews.Content: upon check Robert was very helpful....arriving in Vencie by train and having heavy bags it was such a pleasure to meet a charming man..knowledge of Venice and just excellent service this was no 1. our room was very pleasant....and the breakfast was served in the garden with everything you would want to start your day...it did not end there....on check out I had left a note book with all my travel notes....upon contacting them ...it was being sent to my home at no cost...being in the business myself I understand and value this service thank you so much

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - lovely gardens”
Reviews.Author: YoungandRestless84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right in the Piazzale Roma which has water bus, water taxi, train, bus connections. We were able to check-in early which was nice. The reception staff were friendly and spoke very good english. The room was large and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel if you have connections to make at Piazzale Roma however if you are staying a few days to sightsee I would recommend you stay closer to San Marco and St Mark's Square if you want to be amongst it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: After a very short walk (less than ten minutes) from the Venice train station we were greeted at the hotel by Robert and Roberto. These two gentlemen were extremely personable and helpful during our stay. Recommendations for dinner were especially good. The room was large, comfortable and had character. Our first floor room overlooked the minor canal and despite being over the patio and across from another patio was very quiet. The modern bathroom was large and clean. The included breakfast had a large variety of appetizing food and, if you are lucky, you can find an outdoor spot (only a couple of tables available) for breakfast. The patio which is next to a canal is pleasant and is dutifully attended to by staff. Great place to chat with fellow guests. As die hard walkers we found the location convenient and with the maps provided by the hotel we enjoyed our brief visit to Venice and this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: matildam
Reviews.Content: Our criteria for choosing a hotel in Venice was that it needed to be close to Piazzetta Roma where the Airport bus stops on our arrival,: close to the station for our departure and close to the cruise terminal. This hotel met all of our needs. We could see the bus terminal over the canal and the People Mover ( a mono rail) for the cruise terminal was in the same Piazzetta and cost 1 euro. The hotel was spotlessly clean and beautifully presented in a Venetian style with venetian light fittings and prints and paintings of Venice. One must expect small rooms in Europe and some of the rooms were small but others were quite large so rather than be disappointed, ask about the room when booking, Expect mosquitoes and go prepared.There were none when we were there but we always take our plug in mosquito repeller. A full or Continental breakfast with lots of choice was provided in a bright breakfast room or outside in the garden which was a real suprise. Our first room opened out onto this well maintained private sunny garden. as the garden was in an inner courtyard the rooms looking into it were very quiet. Polite friendly staff added to our enjoyment of this hotel as well as the reasonable tarif! I would definitely stay here again. It is away from the centre but to us, that was an advantage to get away fron the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Quiet, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Havepointswilltravel
Reviews.Content: Very convenienty loated near train and bus terminal. Not near San Marco - thugh an easy walk or vaporetto ride away - which we found a plus because it was VERY easy to find and get to without crowds all around. Room was very clean. Bathroom had obvioulsy been recently remodeled and ws very nice. Breakfast was good, and sitting in the garden for breakfast or for drinks in the afternoon was very nice. The bar area was not much, but after a day of walking/exploting we came back to the hotel and were served tea and drinks inthe garden. Really nice. Recommendation for dinner was very good. Hosteria di Venizia - a very short walk from hotel. Specializes in seafood, my friend raved about his perfectly prepared fish but my lasagna was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “What a charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce255103
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a teacher bringing students on a school trip. When I come back to Venice with my wife, I will definitely be booking here. The rooms are warm and cozy, bringing together the history of the city and the comforts of the 21st century. It is located right near Piazzale Roma, which means that you don't have to worry about getting to your hotel via the canals, but being on a canal itself, it provides easy access to the rest of Venice. I was especially impressed with the staff, in particular Robert, the Welsh gentleman at the front. He made us all feel welcome, especially the students with us. He is a man of class and taste, and his service was top shelf. Grazie, Hotel Olimpia!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: mart031
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The room was quite beautiful, very large by Venice standards, with a canal view and good breakfast. The only complaint is that it is near the end of a vaparato route, and too far to walk at night from San Marco (unless you are actually familiar with the streets and alleys of Venice.) The restaurant, Brucinellis, in the same building was not so great. The bass was very disappointing, and I believe they refill the water bottles with tap water.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: Chandlerx
Reviews.Content: My partner and I was staying at this hotel on September 9, 2011. It was just for one night before heading out for a cruise. The hotel is nice, clean with friendly staff. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was immaculate. Breakfast (included) was excellent! HOWEVER, we were advised that checkout time was 11a.m. We woke up early, went out for a stroll after breakfast. We returned to our room at 10:15a.m. and noticed the room was already made, our luggages gone including our carry-ons. When we went down to concierge, our luggages were sitting out in the open. They had taken the liberty to remove our luggages without asking. Furthermore, our passports, wallets, tour documents were still in the in-room safe. We had to go back to the room to retrieve them. No apologies or explanations were offerred. Luckily we are always careful with our important documents when we travel but our electronics were in our carry--ons. I wasn't going to write a review about this incident but on hindsight, I thought things could have turned out to be a nightmare if anything did go missing. Other than this one incident, I think the hotel is great, especially how easy it is to locate from the bus terminal and close to the port.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: lori l
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after searching for hours on the internet for a relatively inexpensive, clean, centrally located hotel for just a night prior to departing on a cruise. The hotel is centrally located to the piazzale roma (easy access for the blue bus from the airport) and walking distance to the tram which takes you to the port for 1 euro each. When we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff who helped us find a restaurant for a late meal and then directed us to our room. Only complaint we had was the lobby and back gardens looked lovely but we were taken outside and to another door where we climbed 3 flights of stairs with our luggage to our room. It appeared to us, this adjacent building was occupied by apartment tenants and guests of the hotel. The room was decorated in typical italian decor with a small flat screen tv. The bathroom did have a hair dryer but expect to be in there for an hour as it was quite weak. Bed linens are basic, nothing fancy and the pillows are quiet flat. You will have to get up early if you wish to sit outside in the gardens for breakfast because it fills up fast. The breakfast was extensive with meats, cheeses, buns, danishes, croissants, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee, tea. It was also nice to have access to free internet with a computer in the lobby. From the hotel we were able to walk to St. Mark's square but it took about 45 min. Easy to find our way there but difficult on the way back so make sure you carry a map. Overall we would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - convenient to Piazzale Roma!”
Reviews.Author: cmd94583
Reviews.Content: Going on a cruise? The Piazzale Roma area is perfect and this hotel is convenient and nicely appointed. Literally, get off the bus and walk to the back of the parking lot where you will see the hotel across a small canal. Another well-kept secret in this area is the "People Mover" which can get you to the cruise port for 1 or 2 Euro if you don't mind walking a bit and don't have to transport a mountain of luggage (not recommended in Venice anyway). A taxi will cost you 15 Euro to the port from Piazzale Roma. Our room was adequate; the bathroom a little on the small side with a stange tub/shower setup, but okay for the one night we had to deal with it. Comfortable bed though and helpful staff. The garden area is very nice and the breakfast room was really lovely with nice continental breakfast choices. Good restaurant recommendation for dinner was just around the corner (Hosteria di Venezia, I think). Overall, a good place to stay if you want to be near transportation rather than touristy areas. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Quiet & Comfort in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kerilou
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because my brother & sister-in-law had already booked a room here and we were going on a cruise together. I was quite anxious about staying here as we arrive late-ish at night and previous reviewers had said they were placed in another hotel some distance away when they arrived late. I need not have worried. I had sent an email advising that we were part of a family party of six and would all like to be together. The hotel owns the building next door and were all booked into rooms on the same floor there which was very convenient. The rooms were lovely. The only negative was walking up and down the 2 flights of stairs with heavy luggage. The staff on reception were very pleasant & helpful. We had breakfast both mornings looking out over the garden which was lovely and as I had advised our dietary requirements, we were given a package each containing gluten free breakfast items which we could supplement with fruit, meat, cheeses from the breakfast buffet - very impressive! We thought this hotel was well located - we were given a map and walked to Piazza San Marco and back on our first day - a longish walk but very interesting. The next day we caught the vaporetto there (now I know what a sardine feels like!) and walked back. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Back home again”
Reviews.Author: dafish28
Reviews.Content: Having enjoyed the terrific hospitality of this unique Best Western in 2009, we were anxious to return for a second visit, just to be sure we were correct back then when we gave it an outstanding review. In early September this year we returned to find the same excellent management team all still in place, and the welcome we received during our five night stay was like returning to the home of an old friend. This property is in the perfect location for travelers who may be taking a cruise, since it is literally the closest hotel property to the Piazza Roma, and now, with the new people mover tram in full operation, getting to the cruise terminals is much easier. Whether arriving by plane from Marco Polo airport, or by train into Venice station with the new footbridge connecting Piazza Roma, or by bus or car, Hotel Olimpia just cannot be beat for ease of connections. The hotel is under the management of Robert, assisted during the day by Serena, and they go out of their way to answer any and all questions, while providing numerous suggestions for sights to see. In the evening there is Andrea and Rita, who strive to please their guests as well. The morning breakfast, served either in several cozy dining rooms, or out on the patio overlooking a truely beautiful pathwayed garden, makes for a great start to any day. The rooms are tastefully decorated and the ones overlooking the garden are especially quiet. The attitude of the staff makes this our favorite "home away from home" in venice and we will definity return once again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mitcardinal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few minutes distance from Piazzale Roma which is helpful when you need to fly very early in the morning. Robert -- his name is really Roberto but he asked to be called Robert in Tripadvisor -- is very friendly and very knowledgeable about Venice which helped a lot. Clean and quite rooms. They should invest on another Wi-Fi router so you don't have to go down to the garden just to get close to the hot spot.

Reviews.Title: “Close to cruise ship port”
Reviews.Author: sueandlen
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was close to where we had to drop off our hire car and to embark on our cruise ship. Surprised at how much room we had in this hotel. A bellboy to organise luggage to our room, English speaking reception staff advising of the cheapest way to get around Venice. Nice breakfast in the morning and we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel until we were ready to head off to our ship.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: texaskaren68
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights pre-cruise. The location was very convenient, just one bridge away from the Piazzale Roma where you can catch a taxi to the ship, or a Vaporetto to St. Mark's square. The breakfast was very nice, service was fine, and the room was clean and quiet. I would stay here again. The hotel loses one point because a power surge fried my computer's power cord, and we had no electricity in the outlets in the room for a little while in the morning until (I assume) the breaker was reset.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL BUT A BIT PRICY”
Reviews.Author: macbee1910
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay in this hotel for one night, room was lovely as was the location, one down side was that, although the hotel says it offrs parking, you still had to pay for parking nearby at a cost of 30 euros a day!

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to this hotel,it is too far to venice centre and it is a disaster!”
Reviews.Author: elifff
Reviews.Content: tbad value for money,unfriendly people,he reason we booked this hotel was the location and we wre ableto park our car actually my husband had to walk halfmiles upand down the bridges to bring the lugages,water taxi was much closer than hotelwhich can take you anywhere and you can stillpark your car in same otopark,this time reception staff was not sobad but the waitress guys were terrible,actually he shouted us and another family with children becaue they only had one broken one and when we ask how can our baby and toddler sit he start swering in italian,other big problem we expected canal view, recentionist said that well we don have it all gone and canal stinks anyway:)we stayeyed 3 night in annext room looking out back of the buildings,also breakfast was disaster too.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Athomeanywhere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights prior to our cruise. Great location close to Piazza Roma. The room was adiquate, elevator very small but functioned well. The free breakfast was very good. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Ontari0Canuck
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay especially if you are in Venice as your starting point for a cruise. We stayed 3 nights in the annex building which is directly adjacent to the main building. The downside is there is no elevator in the annex but on check-in the porter did take our suitcases to our room. The rooms in the annex look like they had been updated - they were clean and modern and a good size. The hotel in very close to Piazza de Roma and a water bus stop. The train station is perhaps a 15 minute walk from the hotel. We were only one bridge away from the Piazza which if you are dragging suitcases it takes about a 4 minute walk to the hotel. A continental breakfast was included and was satisfactory. If you have the opportunity to have your breakfast or a coffee outside you will be pleasantly surprised by the greenery and space of the backyard outdoor area. It's a real gem. Getting to the cruise ship on the People Mover is located in the Piazza de Roma. Once you get off at the Port Terminal it is a bit of a walk (we were going to the Norwegian cruise terminal) but if you don't have mobility issues it is economical and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lila173
Reviews.Content: After reading a blog from Princess cruise members we decided to stay at the Olimpia Hotel (Best Western). It was moderately priced for Venice, and turned out to be in a wonderful location. It was right on a canal, near to the bus and Vaporetto, restaurants and was a wonderful place to stay. The staff was very helpful and cordial. When we checked in we had to wait as several others were checking in at the same time. They fixed us tea and gave us cold drinks while we waited. The room was clean and comfortable with a queen size bed, and had a wonderful view of the backyard garden, which was lovely. They had a very cute and quaint breakfast room, but you could also take your food outdoors and eat there at the tables & umbrellas as well. There was an elevator, however, our room was in a different section of the hotel and after taking the elevator up one floor we still had to walk up one flight of stairs, which was not a problem for us, however, if one needs to avoid stairs they should mention this to the staff when making the reservation or checking in. We had to leave at 4:30 a.m. for the water taxi to take us to the airport. The staff was so accommodating, that they gave us a coffee pot and coffee for the morning to keep in our room because we were leaving so early. They also gave us a huge bag of croissants, cookies, crackers, and other snacks to have for breakfast and to take with us. This was such a nice gesture. All in all this was a wonderful hotel, and if we return to Venice we would definitely stay there again. We recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... great location... expensive”
Reviews.Author: worldly_travels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night prior to our cruise. The location is great... 2 minute walk from the main bus / car station. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. The room was very, very small... but clean. I would recommend this hotel to singles, couples, and families (if you can handle a small room). Free breakfast is nice. Also, there's a reasonably priced very good restaurant right next to the hotel. Food is pricy in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but staff seemed uninterested”
Reviews.Author: Bezzer1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you want somewhere simple and close to the Piazza Roma where the vaporetti will get you everywhere. Clean, comfy rooms. Lovely breakfasts. Unfortunately the front of house staff were unfriendly and seemed uninterested in the guests. Provided a gluten free breakfast which was fab.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: jennydLancashire
Reviews.Content: So very glad we chose this hotel! Its location is perfect,no long trek after arriving from the airport on the number 5 bus,it is literally two mins. The hotel is really lovely,we had a room off the garden, lovely quiet room,very clean and comfortable,mini fridge,tea and coffee facilities and a fantastic air con system,our room was always lovely and cool so nice to come into after very hot humid days walking!! Also as soon as you enter the main hotel it is always lovely and cool. Lots of nice restaurants and bars just minutes away. The Vaporetta stop is again minutes away,so very handy to get everywhere.This area is a lovely peaceful retreat after very hot busy days. The breakfasts are good and the coffee is really good! you can also have your breakfast in the pretty garden, which we did,lovely start to the day.The staff are very pleasant and helpful,and it was nice to meet Roberto! who amazed us with his very strong welsh accent and yet he said he was from Venice!! Would most definitley return to this hotel and would strongly recommend it. Wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Piazzale Roma”
Reviews.Author: povenden
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to its position just one bridge from Piazzale Roma. We arrived just before midnight and the night porter was very helpful.Our bedroom on the second floor overlooked the garden and was relatively quiet. It was clean and had adequate supply of hot water.The buffet breakfast was adequate with very good coffee. We were sailing from Porto Basilio the next day and not wishing to pull 3 suitcases over many bridges and up/down lots of steps took a taxi ( cost euros16) from P.Roma. A very convenient hotel for a pre cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location location!”
Reviews.Author: travguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at both the Arlecchino and the next door Olimpia pre and post cruise. Like the other reviews found the staff friendly and helpful. Both are under the Best Western flag and it seeems they operate in conjunction. At each we had a tiny room but very clean and adequate. If both were available at the same price I would select the Olimpia because the breakfast was better, the breakfast room was larger and they had a pleasant garden and a small lounge where you could spend a while when waiting for bus/plane/boat etc. In any event the location is almost unbeatable and I saw one of the hotel staff carrying a guest's luggage over the bridge

Reviews.Title: “Close to Buses To Go To Cruise Port!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pctravler
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel to stay at before a cruise. You have to walk two min. to Piazzale Roma to catch free busses to your cruise ship. We stayed in a two bedroom suite. It seems the hotel purchased a few houses behind in the garden. We had un upstairs room with a den ,a pull out couch for my teenagers ,and a seperate room with a king size bed. We even had air conditioning.!!!!!The next morning, we had a nice breakfast for free. I would definataly stay here on my next trip to Venice. You can also take a bus to the airport ,at the Piazza Roma, but since we had 4 people it was almost the same for a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel if you arrive with a car”
Reviews.Author: dykwia
Reviews.Content: In general the hotel is extremely average, the hotel on the inside is not the great thing. There is a part where you can not climb on lift therefore you have to carry your own stuff. Also, the buffet is nothing special. The good side of the hotel is convenient location if you arriving by car. 5 minutes walking is a big parking which has a special tariff if you are staying at the hotel. Also the bad part is that you must carry your bags because you are crossing two bridges on the way to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Economical Elegance”
Reviews.Author: flairbne
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is wonderful for travellers arriving or departing Venice by Cruise ship or Air. Just off the Piazzale Roma where the People Mover train from Cruise Terminal and the Bus Station for the Airport meet. Vaporetti Terminus is 10 minutes walk. Access to Hotel is over a small bridge (17 steps up and down) The hotel is in part of an old monastery dating back to 17th Century and dates to 1990 as a Hotel. Completely made over 3 years ago and furnished in the '700 Venetian style. Very modern Bathroom and other facilities. Beautiful Garden off the Breakfast room, Bar, Canal frontage and very helpful staff with a full range of languages between them. Even Welsh. A very enjoyable stay for a very reasonable tariff.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for transport links whilst being fairly central”
Reviews.Author: ali_heppy
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. 3 star so not massively posh, but location wise if you're arriving by train, car, or airport transfer, you're not going to get much better than this. Our room was right next to the Breakfast room (132 I think). The room was done out in classic Venetian style which was nice. Big bathroom but slightly odd in that the bath was tiny! More like a deep sink (but we found it quite funny). No balcony instead the room led out onto the gardens/breakfast area which was alright for us. Breakfast was OK - plenty of choice but not your standard English bacon and eggs fayre (but hey you're in Italy). Reception staff really helpful and provided us with free maps, free wifi password, and free tea and coffee making facilities, although you have to ask for these things. All in all for the price you can't go wrong. 20ish minute walk to The Rialto Bridge, 30-40 minutes to San Marco's square. But a really pleasant walk with lots of shops, restaurants, bars etc.

Reviews.Title: “Charming rooms, great location,excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Mon55
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor of the room and the size was a real treat. We were not in main part of hotel so no lift but a porter carried our bags up the two flights of stairs. Looked out over the canal and P. Roma. Walked from Santa Lucia Station - which involved going over many bridges with steps. The breakfast area was peaceful especially if early enough to be seated in small outdoor area overlooking a garden. Staff were really helpful and happy to assist with any request.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Jessie222
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! It is close to the Piazzale Roma and not far from the train station. We were able to easily get to our cruise ship. It is located in a great place and walking to shops and restaurants was very easy. We loved the staff especially Roberto who worked at the reception desk. He was pleasant, helpful and most knowledgeable in answering our questions. He has a great sense of humor. Our room overlooked the action. Although small it was delightful and clean with a nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quaint hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Ken_Jan411
Reviews.Content: If we ever make it back to Venice, we definitely know where we'll stay again. The room was great looking over the canal and the staff were exceptional. Excellent continental breakfast while sitting by the beautiful courtyard. Easy to get to and close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: castravel56
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel in wonderful Venice. The hotel staff were all very, very friendly and helpful at all times. Breakfast was excellent, and eating in the garden was especially delightful. Our room was extremely small with a very small window overlooking a canal. Unfortunately, ventilation was not great and the towels were very thin. We might consider staying here again, because the location was fantastic-- very close to Plaza Roma and all the buses to the airport and other parts of Venice, and everything else was within walking distance... eg San Marco square. The location was outstanding; I might hope for a better room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCresident
Reviews.Content: I thought the location was excellent. Very clean. Pleasantly surprised. Good Value. Excellent breakfast. 5 min walk from train station. Easy to find. Would definitely stay hereagain! Great Gelato right around corner for one of the best $ in Venice too!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location for before and after a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Raiseboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a cruise. The location is actually great for people taking a cruise from Venice. It is also only across the bridge from the train station. The hotel is right opposite Piazza Roma the main Bus terminal. You can get a 5 Euro transport to the Airport from this hotel. Also you can wheel your bags over to the People Mover and pay one Euro to get to the Ship port. From this hotel we walked to Rialto bridge in about 20 minutes, and about the same distance to St. Marco square. The hard part is navigating the streets as there are so many alleys. We used the signs on the wall that guide you to both these sites. The hotel had free wireless internet and was clean and comfortable. We had three rooms for our party of 9, and two rooms faced the canal. Rooms was very good in size and clean. Getting the bags up to the room were a challenge as the elevator is very small. We put a few bags in the elevator and selected the floor, so the bags would get to the floor as you raced up the stairs. The check in and check out were time consuming as there is a lot of paperwork, but then I noticed that through my stay in Italy. Right behind the alley from the hotel is a nice restaurant with a very friendly staff. The food was pretty pricey, but the atmosphere was great. Also the hotel has a back door that leads to a really nice park/garden area. I would highly recommend this hotel if you plan a cruise from Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming 3* Hotel & Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: ktn28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend and it is a very charming property. Hotels in Venice are very expensive and I thought the price was on the more reasonable side. I also like the fact that the hotel is closer to the train station than St. Mark's Square because with luggage and a short stay it is so much more convienent. We loved strolling through the winding streets and canals making our way towards St. Mark's Square. Usually took us around 30 mins, but it really is a lovely walk. Rooms are small and breakfast is basic but as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: GirlyBelgrade
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 2 nights with our dog. The room was clean, garden view, Venetian style. The breakfast was so nice. Little garden is precious, so morning coffee in the garden was such pleasure. Also very important is the hotel position. It is so close to the garage so you do not have to be worried to find water taxi or water bus and pay extra money for that , just to get to your hotel. Enjoyed it , very much !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcsven
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Convenient to Piazzale Roma at the top end of Venice, not centrally located to the city but you can easily take the Vaporetto or just walk to wherever you want to go in fabulous Venice. Hotel staff was great, our travelling companion accidentally left a backpack(with everything in it) outside the Hotel and we were gone for 10-15 minutes before he ran back to get it, the staff had noticed it, taken it inside and put it behind the counter, and they were as happy as us that the backpack was reunited with its owner. Our window view was out towards the Piazzale Roma but was able to watch the Gondoliers set up in the morning in the little waterway in front of the hotel. The hotel hallways are narrow and if you are claustrophobic you will not be taking the elevator(very tiny) but the rooms were nice enough, breakfast buffet was good also. Overall you really cannot go wrong unless you have a strong desire to be in a different part of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “As the other review say..”
Reviews.Author: meadowbrookowners
Reviews.Content: Was clean and comfortable, great location if you are crusing (as we were). For once I had no complaints about a hotel. Well maybe one, pretty pricey but that's the way it is in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and Location”
Reviews.Author: No2curry
Reviews.Content: Like others we found this hotel to be a little gem. I had booked it based on its proximity to the Cruise ship terminal, the bus station and the train station. It ticked all those boxes and I wasn't expecting a lot more as we were only going to be there a couple of nights. However we were given a Garden room (132) which opened onto the little oasis of a garden which was a real bonus for Venice. We could have breakfast out there and also found it a sun trap later in the afternoon where we could relax after doing Venice by day. We would definately go back as it is easily accessible and 200 yards from the Vaparretto at Piazzale Roma

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: DottiG
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Olimpia. The room was clean and pleasant and the staff very helpful. We loved the location as it was easy to walk to from the bus station and just a short walk to the vaporetto. The gardens at the hotel were beautiful and we would stay here again our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest location!”
Reviews.Author: Jacques1313
Reviews.Content: The Olimpia Hotel (Best Western) is located a short walk from the bus terminal (10 minutes) We took the bus from the airport - bus #5, a half hour trip. On arrival in Venice we went to the information booth. They pointed to the pink building - our hotel. In less than two hours after arrival at the airport we were checked in and ready to explore Venice. The hotel room is small but you get a great feeling of the city as you open your window and see all the rooftops. The rooms are all newly renovated and in fantastic shape. The breakfast room is outstanding and is included with the room. Travelling about the city is easy because of the hotel location. Take water bus 1 or 2. The hotel is at the Roma end of Venice. It is very easy to get about the city. It is wise to take a full day pass on the water bus because you can get on and off as often as you want for the whole day. It's an island, you can't get lost really. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend - Great sitting area in front along canal and courtyard in back”
Reviews.Author: jday-tx
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Best Western Olimpia last week for two nights. It was a wonderful hotel with a great location. It is less than a five minute walk from the train station (just over three bridges), and about three minute walk from one of the main vaporetto stops (water bus). What I enjoyed the most is the side walk in front of the hotel with a sitting area right along one of the smaller canals. You can just sit there as long as you want without having to order anything. You can also take your breakfast there or go to the back courtyard area which is also a very nice sitting area. The restaurant next door to the hotel was very yummy and offered a good selection of local cuisines. After peaking in several of the rooms, I can tell you that it seems ever room is different. Ours opened up first into a small sitting area with a couch then curved past the bathroom into the bedroom. We had a cute little window that opened and overlooked the garden. There was a real queen size bed for my husband and I and then our daughter slept in the twin size bed that folded out of the wall like a hide-a-bed. The hotel has a computer down stairs with internet access and also free wireless access in the rooms. The only down side was that the wireless was not very strong and difficult to use in our room which was located in a far corner from the lobby. I had no problem using it by the stairs or sitting out along the canal in front of the hotel - which was a much better place to sit and surf anyway. A few other tips for your vencie trip - get a 24 hour or 48 hour vaporetto pass (just like a bus pass but the bus is a boat). You can ride it around town as many times as you like and if you get lost walking around sooner or later you will come to a bus stop. If you decided to do a tour, I highly suggest doing a private water taxi tour in the EVENING. We did ours starting at 6:30 which was a great time to be on the Grand Canal - less traffic and not as hot. After the tour we did a minor canal gondola ride (around 8:30 or 9) which was great. Very quiet and peacefull. Hope you enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Free wifi!!! Awsome location. Pictures do it no justice.”
Reviews.Author: Twithoutm
Reviews.Content: The pics on trip advisor website di the hotel no justice. I had low expectations but this place far exceeded expectations once I saw with my own eyes. Decor is old world styled but very new. Its just for the style. Free wifi and a complementary breakfast of champions every morning. I'm so glad I stayed here especially since arriving and leaving was made simple by the close proximity to the train and bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Tiger4me
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 8 nights afer my research on Vience and review of the comments on the Tripadvisor site. This hotel met all of our requirements. It is located near the Airport bus terminal, the train station for our day trips and the water bus for our daily commute. The room is very clean, the staff is very friendly and the morning breakfast is terrific - with a lot of fresh fruits. I had a fairly good rate as I pre-paid for our room at reservation. Thanks to Andrea who gave us a room with nice view of a canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Polack99
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided everything we wanted, needed, expected, and then some. The staff was excellent and very helpful and accomodating. Breakfast was terrific and offered something for everyone. Location was great, close to the train station and also close to great restaurants, and a very short walk to the major sites and attractions. We loved our stay and will definitely stay there again next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marianparoo
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes from Piazalle Roma. Clean as a whistle. Comfy room. Good breakfast. Nice restaurants on the block and 'round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, fantastic value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Emmavictoria1989
Reviews.Content: Went to Venice for my 21st Birthday last year with my fiance and stayed at this hotel. It was in the perfect location! you have to get the bus (cannot remember which number) to piazzale roma into Venice, we got off the bus and there was our hotel literally 3 minutes away! Perfect location! It was very quiet and not noisey at all considering it was near the bus stops etc. The room was small, but nice and clean and nicely decorated. It was easy to get around from the hotel and you could walk to places like the campo Santa margarita easily!
