There was a couple of restaurants close by (which id recommend as we had a meal near St Marks Square- compleate rip off stay away from touristy areas if you dont want to spead a lot on food!) and a few pizza takaway places and a supermarket about 15-20 mins walk away. The breakfast was basic, but nice and the Breakfast room was nicely decorated too. The receptionst was friendly and spoke good english and the staff were friendly and helpful. Would deffiantly recommend and definatly would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: clarebirty
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic break in Venice. This was our 3rd time staying at this hotel and would love to come back soon. When we arrived Andrea made us feel very welcome. Our rooms were 402 and 403 they were very clean and spacious. Breakfast was very nice with lots to choose from. The location is very good as you dont have to walk far from piazzale roma when you get dropped off from the Airport. Thankyou once again for a fantastic stay. We will be back. Thankyou Clare. UK

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel close to Piazza Roma”
Reviews.Author: paganwoman
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is very close to the Piazza Roma and to the vaporetto stops. We had just finished a cruise and took the shuttle bus to P Roma and just walked across a bridge to the hotel. When we left to go to the airport the bus was only the same short walk away. The hotel itself is a very charming building with a lovely courtyard and blooming flowers with is so great to have in Venice. The P Roma is close but not so close you feel you are at the edge of a parking lot. If fact you wouldn't even know the buses arrived so close to the hotel the way the hotel is situated. The rooms are furnished and decorated in "Venician style" and the staff is great and eagar to help in any way they can. The one computer in the lobby was helpful to keep me updated on my emails and such. We had to leave at 4:30am to catch the bus back to the airport (another big advantage of this hotel location) and the hotel gave us a bag filled with snack type food for us since we were too early for breakfast. The gentleman on the desk at that time of the morning was real helpful in letting us eat some of the food in the breakfast area and helping us get to our early bus. If your are staying in Venice after a cruise or have a real early flight or just want a great reasonable hotel with easy access to the bus or vaporetto stops this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: Flyingscot100
Reviews.Content: Two bridges from the bus station,beside a canal, near the Grand canal, near the Vecco Pozzo restaurant (see separate review). The easiest way to get to the city from the airport is probably the bus and complimentary buses run to the cruise port. The decor has real character and the staff, breakfast,internet access are what you would expect from a very good professionally run hotel. On average we paid less than 100 euros a night for a double room good value in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “As a weekend break base they don't get better”
Reviews.Author: JohnandCarolineUK
Reviews.Content: Difficult to fault. 2 minutes from bus station ideal for stroll or water buses to all sights. Bars and restaurants nearby. Rooms are clean and well equipped and nicely furnished in Venetian style. Spotless, efficient and great breakfast. Nice garden is an unusual bonus. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ataga
Reviews.Content: The location is the best as the hotel is really only 2 minutes walk from Venice St. Lucia train station. As someone already mentioned there is free computer access which is great, breakfast is huge but it's not warm like English breakfast, in bathroom there are only shampoos and shower gels.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1115
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olimpia post cruise.The hotel was a short walk from Piazzale Roma(bus stop) .In Venice you want to be close to your hotel especially with luggage.We checked in the hotel early ,the room was not ready so we walked around. The water buses were on strike that day so off we went on foot.! We returned to the hotel, the rooms were ready,the staff could not have been nicer!! Each room was a little different in size and style, typical Venitian,charming,bright,updated bathrooms and clean.! The breakfast was good,buffett style,great coffee.There was a backyard with lawn chairs very rare in Venice.We bought a 2 day waterbus pass for 28euros the stops were @Piazzale Roma so went everywhere! I've stayed in other BestWesterns in Europe had the same wonderful experience. The front desk staff Irina,Andrea and the man with glasses(can't remember his name) were the best. I highly reccomend this hotel especially for pre or post-cruise stay or any stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to start your trip in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: momberk
Reviews.Content: We arrived early, but rooms were ready. Front desk staff were very helpful and cheerful. The elevator is tiny, but we went up two by two and the desk staff brought the luggage up for us. Since it was my first time in Italy, and dealing with the Eruos, I was not sure how much to tip, but the gentlemen told me I gave too much and return some coins. The rooms were bright and cheerful, but had the "old world" Charm. The beds were very comfortable with extra blankets and pillows in the closet. We had a corner room with had cross ventilation and the view from one of our windows was of the beautiful gardens below. My old "complaint- would be that the shower was tight, but we managed. The breakfast was a feast of pastries, cereals, cheeses, meats and they came with fresh coffee and steamed milk. Everyone was very cheerful and helpful. They also had access to a computer so we could update our family on our daily adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Two minute walk from the bus station”
Reviews.Author: brindlenoi
Reviews.Content: Hotel perfect for a 2day break.Room very clean and staff very efficient.Superb location very convient for the airport bus and the Waterbus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: danishKent
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel to stay in Venice. Close to the bus station so it's very convenient if you chose to take the bus from the airport. There is a nice choice to choose at breakfast but if you want a cooked one there is an additional charge. The rooms are lovely and comfortable with tea/coffee making facilities. There is also a lovely garden to enjoy as well. The manager and staff were very helpful with information and provide you with a map if required. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jolly33
Reviews.Content: From arrival to checkout everything was wonderful from staff to rooms.Robert who was on reception in the evenings was very pleasent and helpful.Breakfast was good with a good variety The rooms were very nicely decorated and cleaned every day. There are many restuarants and snack bars close by..Location was near the bus station a few minutes walk with cases from where the airbus terminates..The airbus was a good deal at 3 euros each. The hotel is about 25 minutes walk from St Marks Square, we invested in a 3 day waterbus pass and went all over Venice. and the Islands.I can only say you will not be disappointed staying here and from all my party a big thank you to the staff at Hotel Olimpia.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: par7_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and really appreciated the friendly helpful staff. The only small problem that we had no tea/coffee making facilities on arrival but a quick word at reception soon amended this. The hotel is in a very good location being close to the bus and train stations and within walking distance of many good restaurants, yet was quiet and peaceful. Woud recommend to anyone but suggest that if visiting Venice in March be sure to pack an umbrella.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and not expensive”
Reviews.Author: Vorchun
Reviews.Content: Good location for trip by car: about 150 meters to car parking, San Marco about 2 km walking.

Reviews.Title: “exellent location and brilliant value shame about the construction work going on.”
Reviews.Author: flopsymillington
Reviews.Content: This hotels location was absolutely brilliant, right near the bus station and boat staion so stress free transfer from the airport to the hotel, then easy to catch water bus around venice, its easy to get lost in venice on foot so this was very handy! San Polo is about 10 mins away on the water boats and other areas of interest can be found through various other stops along the way. The busy bar area of venice is within walking distance of the hotel, great if you like a few late drinks after the water bus stops running. The hotel was very nice, rooms really clean and nicely decorated. quite small rooms but brilliant value for money. The only down side was the construction going on at the time our stay. Workemen started at 6am so we were up bright and early! We had no water at one stage and were lied to by the reception staff. We were told that the water often went off in this hotel and were told it would be back on in 5 mins. it wasnt, so we gave up and went out for the day! on our return later we found water leaking through the reception ceiling. When i asked the staff about it they informed me that the builders had cut through a water pipe. I really dont understand why we were not told the truth earlier in the day! Although this was annoying we still had a brilliant holiday in venice. The buffet breakfast was quite simple but very fresh and tastey. I would recomend this hotel to people looking for simple accomidation in a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in front of Piazzale Roma bus terminal”
Reviews.Author: amrotefa
Reviews.Content: Good and recommended hotel Pros: -Wonderful breakfast buffet -Located in front of the bus terminal with only 1 bridge to cross on foot with luggage Cons: -Some construction was going on at the time, so not very quiet in the morning -Didn't like the classic furniture which looked a bit old Overall experience was good

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at a nice tourist class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trevorbord
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Best Western Hotel Olimpia over the new year holiday for four nights. It is everything it claims to be and it looks just like the photos on the website. The front desk staff was very helpful and the dining room staff was great too. The Hotel is located about a minutes walk from the vaporetto station. You should buy an extended vaporetto pass if you are going to be in town for a stretch of time. The railway station was a short three minute walk away, and St. Mark's Square took about 1 hour at a leisurely pace to reach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location - would go back there in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: WDWfans
Reviews.Content: Located near the train station, this charming hotel on a smaller canal is nearby the water taxi stand. There are restaurants right outside the hotel - but ask at the desk for the best places to eat! Every place that they suggested provided an unbelievable meal, in non-touristy locations - just great! The hotel room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was filling and delicious. We truly enjoyed our stayed in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel; friendly, professional staff; reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: dbmmock
Reviews.Content: The Olimpia is conveniently located near Plaza Roma, which is where the buses, taxis, and t rains drop off their passengers. Visitors to Venice know that the city has canals in lieu of streets. What they don't appreciate until they arrive is that people cross the canals on bridges. Lugging suitcases through Venice is a chore. There are only two bridges to the Olimpia (three from the train station). The Olimpia is well appointed. Accommodations were very comfortable. We had a large bathroom with an over-sized shower and a bidet. The hotel is located on a very small canal. There are a number of restaurants that are near the restaurant. Breakfast is excellent. This is important because it is not easy to find breakfast in Venice. Professional staff. Internet is available for a modest charge. Nice courtyard. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel in a Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: Gill006
Reviews.Content: This was my our first visit to Venice for my husbands 50th birthday. I chose it from the internet because the reviews were very good, and it looked lovely in the photos. It is also close to the main station which was quite important as we travelled in by train, an unforgettable experience through the alps from Zurich. Our rooms were beautifully furnished in the traditional style, the bathroom modern and very clean. We also had a little sitting room attached. The bed was very comfortable and the view over the garden very pleasant. We had a widescreen television in the bedroom and a small one in the sitting room, also fridge and mini bar. It was plenty warm enough for the colder weather. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful from the reception staff to the breakfast waiting staff and the chambermaid, and made our stay very enjoyable. The hotel itself is very close to the Grand Canal, and it is easy to walk to all the major sightseeing places and shops and close to Water bus and Gondola pick-ups. It fronts on a smaller canal and it must be very pleasant to sit out in the warmer months. There is also a very nice garden behind the hotel with seats for sitting out. It is just off a very busy square, but itself in a fairly quiet situation, and there are several very good restaurants a short walk away. The Continental breakfast provided within the price was extremely good and plenty of variety for all tastes. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and will definitely stay again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with great employees and views”
Reviews.Author: Bucketlist2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Olympia is a charming hotel with a great location for cruise travelers and tourist. The rooms are small( typical for Europe) but uniquely decorated. The hotel staff was very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal choice”
Reviews.Author: papajoe1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Olimpia was excellent. We stayed there for 13 days and we couldn't have chosen a better hotel. Our only complaints would be that the bed was a bit firm for our liking. Also, their coffee could be better. I preferred to get my caffe or cappuccino from any of the bars nearby. The Olimpiaâ€™s position is ideal. It can be seen from Piazzale Roma and there is only one bridge to cross. Itâ€™s very close to vaporetti and less than 10 minutes walk to Campo Santa Margherita. The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Andrea even offered to make me coffee at 6am when I wanted to go out exploring early one morning. His recommendation on a gondola ride was right on target. The two gentlemen named Roberto always had smiles and a pleasant "buongiorno" and knew all the best places to eat. Iriana was a pleasure to deal with and knew where to shop. They and the other staff made our stay in Venice even better than it would have been. The breakfast was good with many choices of fresh meats, cheeses, fruit, bread etc. you could even order a hot breakfast if you wanted to. Venice can be a rather expensive place to visit, but we felt that we got a great value in the Olimpia. We had a double superior room (#110) and it was very spacious compared to other European hotels we had stayed in. It was also kept very clean and well tended. When we closed the widows it was very quiet, but we liked the noise and the cool air so we slept with the windows open most nights. I highly recommend you upgrade to this class of room. I canâ€™t say enough good things about the Hotel Olimpia. On our future visits this will be our home of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed management”
Reviews.Author: chunkwok
Reviews.Content: I & my wife booked the hotel with credit card on the early Nov. and received confirmation number online. When we arrived on Nov. 11 late night because of the delayed flight, the reception desk guy put us to the hotel next door called Hotel Arlecchino and did not give any explanation. The guy at Hotel Arlecchino said that both hotels are under the same management and the rooms are all the same. The 2 nights stay is alright since room is clean and the service is acceptable. When we went to the Hotel Olipmia front desk next day to ask for the reason of putting us to Hotel Arlecchino, the staff at front desk insisted that they are under the same owner, same management, all rooms are same. When we checked out on Nov. 13 heading out for cruise tour, we paid out cash. However when we were back home in Vancouver,Canada we found out that there was a debit transaction by Hotel Olimpia stated on my credit card account statement. Very disappointed! Need time to get the money back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: zoom802
Reviews.Content: Wife and I traveled to Venice 3 days before our cruise departure; had a wonderful time! Hotel staff was more than accommodating...eager to please. Since my birthday was during our stay, I asked staff to make reservations at a local restaurant for us...they did...and we had a great time! Rooms were small, but comfortable...breakfast was more than adequate...very tasty. Location lends itself to local waterbus stops, shopping, convenient travel to cruise ship port. This was our 3rd visit to Venice; when we go again, I will definitely consider staying at Hotel Olimpia. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a hotel in Venice choose this one”
Reviews.Author: Fingalflyer
Reviews.Content: Just back from an excellent few days at this hotel. The location is first class you can actually see it from the Piazzale le Roma Bus Station. Its right on the canal bank, is very close to all the attractions and transport hubs. Hotel is quiet at night, the room was excellent, breakfast had a great choice on offer and the staff are both friendly and helpful. Just one small point and this is common to a lot of hotels, turn the heat down!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: dittoaway
Reviews.Content: Minutes from the airport shuttle stop. Minutes from the Grand Canal. Quiet garden for end of the day drinks. Bring your own wine; they'll open it for you and supply glasses and an ice bucket. Free. Book directly from the hotel web-site. Price can't be beat and you won't have to worry about a third party screwing up your reservation. Great multi-language service at the front desk. Thanks Mirco!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to activities and cruise terminal....”
Reviews.Author: lenflady
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night prior to our cruise (Oct 15th). We arrived at the hotel around 2pm so we were able to check into the room immediately. We were on the top floor, 4th floor. The porter took our luggage up for us as only the two of us were able to fit into the tiny elevator. The only reason why I'm giving the room 3 stars is because it was quite small as it was on what appeared to be on an attic level. I'm not sure of the size of the rooms on the levels below compared to the top floor but it was for only one night. The 3 stars for value is due to the room size and the current exchange rate - the rate ended up being $262.00 on my credit card. I am aware of smaller rooms in Europe and it's unfortunate the euro dropped significantly since the time the reservation was made. At least the prompt and friendly service and location made up for some of this. Though the room was quite small, the bathroom was very large and the entire room very clean. We were able to see the cruise ships from the bedroom window the next day! The location is excellent - take the express bus from Marco Polo airport to the Piazza le Roma and you will see the hotel. The only drawback - you must take your luggage down a set of stairs, across the walkway, up a set of stairs, over the bridge, and down a set of stairs, and then down a couple more stairs to get to the walkway to the hotel. Some previous reviewers simply stated going over one bridge - I was under the impression it would be a flat brige. No. There are stairs on each side of the bridge making it a bit of a task after a long flight so take your time when doing this. Otherwise, the location is great as I saw other hotels I had looked at further away that would have been difficult to get to by bus and foot. The train station is nearby but the bus to Piazza le Roma is closest and your best and inexpensive option (3 euro pp) to get to the hotel. We saw many people lugging suitcases throughout Venice. Roberto and the rest of the desk staff were very accommodating and friendly! The continental breakfast included was very nice with an extensive variety of foods and you had the option of ordering food cooked to order for a nominal price. The staff noticed my companion hadn't come down for breakfast in the morning and even offered us food even though the breakfast was over! The hotel seems to be situated close to shops, restaurants and major attractions. If you are taking a cruise, go back to the Piazza le Roma and you will find the free shuttle buses for the cruise lines stationing in an area close to the Olimpia.

Reviews.Title: “A poor experience”
Reviews.Author: catie2000
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in January when I booked my cruise for my 50th birthday, through Expedia. After catching an early morning flight, and hauling our heavy luggage from the bus depot, I was not pleased to be told that the hotel was overbooked and we had to move to another hotel. This has been reported by other reviewers here, and therefore must be common practice. I have used Expedia many times and never experienced this problem before. I find it difficult to accept that the hotel did not receive the booking from Expedia until the day we arrived. I can only assume that the hotel deliberately overbooks. We received no apology or compensation for our inconvenience. I won't be using this hotel again and would not recommend to anyone wanting a relaxing and stress free start to their holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to port and charming rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TekPa
Reviews.Content: 4 of us left on a cruise leaving from the port at Venice, Italy. I researched hotels near the port and decided on the Olimpia, which is quite close to Plaza Roma, where buses and taxis park. We booked 2 rooms, which were very different, but both quite nice, although small. My room was on the 4th floor. A porter took up our bags - the elevator didn't have room for us and the luggage (elevator barely fits 2 people). We spent 2 nights there and were delighted with the service and helpfulness of the desk clerks. The only problem is the 2 bridges which must be crossed from Plaza Roma. Lugging suitcases up and over the bridges wasn't fun, but we didn't see any hotels that were accessible without a bridge adventure. There were porters at Plaza Roma, but they were quite expensive (80 euros as I recall), so we opted to schlepp them ourselves. It really isn't too difficult if you take your time. We finally did find a ramp from the Plaza which eliminated one bridge. From the Plaza to the port in a several minute bus ride. There's also a "people mover" if you want to walk to the port from the plaza. After the bridge adventure, though, we opted to wait for the bus to the port. I recommend the hotel, especially for those who are leaving on a cruise. It's proximity to the Plaza is helpful - water taxis and water buses as well as street taxis and buses are all available at the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SookeB.C.Schoolbus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. My elderly parents were also travelling with us. We found the hotel easily after arriving from Marco Polo airport via the bus. The hotel is about a 3 minute walk from the bus depot. The hotel staff were very friendly, the rooms clean and the breakfast buffet was excellent. The only complaint I have is that on the 2nd night stay, after our cruise, they put us in 2 rooms that were at the top of a long stairway. My parents are 85 and 87 and although they made it up and down ok I really don't think this was very good. We booked this hotel in June and we had a seniors rate so they certainly should have been able to accommodate a little better I think. As mentioned in another review there are mosquitoes flying in since there are no screens on the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Best Decision Made in Venice”
Reviews.Author: wheretogoplus
Reviews.Content: Hotel Olimpia is so easy to spot from PIazzale Roma. We came off a cruise ship, used the People Mover for one euro each, walked to south east corner of P. Roma and there it was. Location by a canal is so romantic. We were surprised and impressed with the classic decor especially our room which we got for a well-discounted price through vanere.com. Comfortable double bed with pretty chandelier over it. The bathroom is quite modern and clean. Great breakfast buffet, service is excellent. Front desk staff are so helpful, no language barrier here. The hotel will store your luggage in a locked room at no charge, before check-in or after check-out so you can get to explore Venice a little bit more. Special thanks to Mouzadli (?) for always being there to assist us with the luggage. We know where to stay when we go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, conveniently located, clean, comfortable, friendly”
Reviews.Author: PianoManRon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights before boarding a cruise. I picked this place because of its convenient location to the Piazalle Roma, the hub for cars and buses to access Venice, and the cruise terminals. I knew I'd have a lot of luggage and didn't want to struggle with them up and down bridges, over canals, and down narrow streets of Venice. The hotel is only 2 min walk from where the cab dropped me off from the airport, and I only had to go over one bridge with my bags. I was pleasantly surprised with this place. It was quiet, comfortable, and the room had very nice design and amenities. The free breakfast buffet in the morning was terrific, with patries, eggs, meats, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, breads, coffee, tea, etc. I found the staff helpful and friendly. My only gripe is that they do not have internet wifi in the rooms. To access the internet, you have to go to the lobby to pick up the signal. If you have you're own computer, it is free of cost. If you use the 1 computer they have in the lobby, it comes with a fee of 5 Euros. I will book this hotel again next spring for my return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer186222
Reviews.Content: Be advised not to leave any cash in your room. We only stayed 1 night in the hotel and had Â£300 cash stolen from our locked room!! Staff were very unhelpful and insinuated we had made a mistake and probably spent it!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Location if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: lynrob
Reviews.Content: Found hotel direction instructions easy to follow If staying after a cruise just get on the shuttle to venice in 3 minutes â‚¬1.00 from port entrance to Piazzale Roma-go straight across you can see hotel on right over a bridge lovely hotel nice room ,basic breakfast hot food avaliable at a price, restaurants nearby easy to visit main sites hop on a river bus or walk must go on gondola â‚¬80.00 cheapest price free tea and coffee tray avaliable for room just ask at reception just ask for an iron if needed at reception

Reviews.Title: “expectations exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: capitalstraveller
Reviews.Content: For our tenth visit to Venice, we needed to try and find an hotel nearer to the Ferrovia than previously, in an attempt to ease the last stage of the outbound journey (but frustrated by a Flybe plane breakdown!). Booking accommodation which Google Earth showed to be next to the bus station and car park seemed a bit risky, but in the event this proved to be a very good choice - despite staff concerns that rooms at the front of the hotel might be noisy, ours (room 305) was acceptably quiet and beautifully furnished and decorated: though why the architect made the shower cubicle so small in a sizeable bathroom is a mystery!. Unusually for Venice, the hotel has the whole of the ground floor, giving more space for reception, bar and breakfast room - and the delightful garden at the rear was a real bonus. We understand that there are additional rooms beyond the garden and that the neighbouring Arlecchino Hotel is sometimes used as an overflow - same ownership, but not Best Western. Staff at the hotel were unfailingly helpful and courteous and our only problem was that the coffee cups in our room were never washed - why, one wonders? There was a "cheap-and-cheerful" snack bar opposite the hotel with a young waiter who spoke excellent English, and the adjacent Trattoria Alle Burchielle was adequate. We were warned off the other restaurants closest to the hotel but found a warm welcome and good value (for Venice, that is!) at the Trattoria Venexiana, just a few minute's walk away. If it wasn't for the journey, and if we ever return, we'll certainly use the Olimpia again: the Sant'Elena would be our second choice, but it's just a bit too remote.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MKtravelingfirsttime
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very comfortable and in easy walking distance of every thing there was to see in Venice. We only got lost about a hundred times but always managed to find our way back to the Olimpia! Everyone was very helpful and courteous. When we checked out the man in front of us was complaining about getting charged twice for one omelette. 11 euro instead of 5.50. It turns out the same thing happened to us! But... it was a great omlette so.... we didn't complain. If you stay here, have a great time. We sure did. M&K

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for anyone going on a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay here for two nights recently and would definitely recommend this hotel to cruise travelers leaving from or arriving in Venice. Staff: All of the staff members were very helpful, front desk, dining room and housekeeping. We arrived early in the day (10:30 am) and were able to store our bags until the room was ready in the afternoon. Facilities: The building is a little old and space in the main building is tight (the elevator, like many in Europe, can fit maybe one person and one large bag at a time). However, there is a nice garden with some open space and chairs out back and there is an annex building. We stayed there and had one of the largest hotel rooms weâ€™d ever seen in Europe. Both the bedroom and the bath were very large, with lots of storage space and floor space for multiple bags. Both our room and the common areas were kept tidy and clean, although the lobby was a little worn. Breakfast was included and they dining area was comfortable with a nice selection of breads, cheeses, fruits, cereals, meats, etc. Coffee was delicious! Highlights: The location was a plus for us. The hotel is within eye-sight of the Piazzale Roma and the People Mover to the cruise port. That made getting from the airport to the hotel very easy (3 euros via the ATVO Fly Bus). It was just a two minute walk from the bus to the hotel, which does include going up and over one bridge, but youâ€™ll have that just about anywhere in Venice. Leaving for our cruise was just as easy and it took less than 15 minutes to get to our cruise terminal. It was about a 20-25 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge or Piazza San Marco, but we actually liked the walk back. It was great for getting some gelato and strolling slowly back to the hotel. Plus, we got to see a lot of different parts of Venice depending on which way we walked back. Areas for improvement: The shower didnâ€™t have a shelf or a holder for soap or shampoo, so we had to take a cup and use that to put the soap in while in the shower. Also, the Wi-Fi does not extend to the rooms in the garden annex, so that was not good. The common areas could be updated as well, but for the price, this is a very good value. Overall impression: For the price, this is a well run and decent place to stay. If you like to walk and are interested in saving money getting from the airport to your hotel, this is a great money saver because you donâ€™t have to pay for a water bus or taxi and can use the money you save to spend on more important thingsâ€¦like gelato! Nearby transportation: ATVO Fly Bus stops in Piazzale Roma, which you can see from the hotel. There is also a vaporetto stop in Piazzale Roma so you can easily catch one of the main routes to go to or from Piazza San Marco or other main locations in town. Additionally, the People Mover (which costs 1 euro) to and from the main cruise port is in Piazzale Roma as well so itâ€™s very convenient if youâ€™re doing a cruise originating or arriving in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: oklahoma12
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, good food, the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good option - convenient location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Gertrude01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Olimpia in August with my husband and 2 teenage daughters. We had 2 rooms on the same floor. It was a good experience. The location is convenient to all the public transportation. It is easy to find when you take the bus in from the airport, and very convenient to get the vaporetti to Murano & Burano as well as those that go to San Marco. You can also walk into town quite easily. The staff were all nice. The rooms themselves were okay although the rooms themselves felt like they could use some freshening up. Part of that is probably just the standard for the city though. Everything was clean and the beds were comfortable. Although one of the rooms faced the bus depot it wasn't noisy. They have wifi in the lobby you can use free of charge. In terms of restaurants, we had one terrible experience and one excellent experience. The terrible experience was a tourist trap at a square an easy walking distance from the hotel. It is called Fuori Rotta. Definitely avoid. It is the most expensive bad meal I've every had and the service was rude on top of it all. The good place is Osteria Mocenigo which is also an easy walking distance from the hotel in the direction of Rialto. There we had a terrific meal and excellent service for less money. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - close to bus stop and cruise departure!”
Reviews.Author: lmeinen
Reviews.Content: My 19 year-old granddaughter and I stayed at Hotel Olimpia for two nights before our cruise. It was right across the canal from the bus parking lot (two minute walk). The breakfasts were very good and our room overlooked a canal and small restaurant. We were able to walk everywhere (even to Marco Polo Square) and didn't have to rely on a water taxi at any time. Never did take a gondola ride as it was very expensive and we wanted to walk to our destinations. There are many restaurants right around the corner of the hotel. Be sure to check out the pizza shop around the corner. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hillbilly60
Reviews.Content: Thank you tripadvisor. We just got back from italy and the stay at Hotel Olimpia was great and just as your reviews stated. One nice thing not mentioned was that in the bathrooms there were elec. outlets with a power converter built in. A switch changed it from 220 to 110, very handy. I wish I had known that before I bought the converter I never used.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for OAP”
Reviews.Author: petaling
Reviews.Content: close to P le Roma. but you still have cross one bridge. Adequate breakfast. Receptionists not too helpful and sometimes overwhelmed by personal bookings and cruise-line bookings.So nothing above and beyond.Refused to let us eat breakfast at 655am. prior to airport shuttle trip

Reviews.Title: “Great location easy to park and get to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: esoxrobb
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, easy to get to without having to carry bags too far. Overlooking one of the side canals with a good location to see Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Very Easy to Find-Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Cruisaholic21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decorated very nicely. You could look out and see the side canal which was fun. We stayed there two separate times and the first room was small with a hard bed on the 5th floor, but the second room we had was on the second floor and it was larger with a more comfortable bed. The breakfast buffet was so good and the hotel had a great courtyard out back. We loved the location because we took the bus to the Plaza Roma and you could look over and see the hotel's name without any trouble trying to find it. It is also close to the rail road and bus terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonFifi_04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in April. Caught the airport bus to the bus staion and the hotel is literaly 5 minutes walk from there. Very easy to find and you don't need to rely on taxi's, water buses etc. We had a room on the ground floor overlooking the lovely garden nice and quiet except perhaps if people were sitting outside early to eat their breakfasts and the windows were open. Not much of an issue though. Room fairly small but perfectly fine, loads of room to hang clothes. Bathroom though was a good size with a separate shower cubicle. Breakfast was buffet style and there was a huge amount of choice and all very tasty. The water bus stop was a few minutes walk away and all the water buses that went up the grand canal left from there. Although the hotel is not centrally based it doesn't take longt o walk to all the major sights and is in fact a very pleasent way to see Venice by just wandering around all the little canals and streets. Perhaps something we would have missed if we had stayed nearer St Marks square for example. There were a number of nice restuarants and bars around the hotel and not overly expensive. Would definately recommend this hotel and the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Spirit of Venice”
Reviews.Author: elmadanat1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel since we had a cruise next day , this hotel is cenrally located between S.L train station and venice port . It's small , rooms are retalively small , furniture was old but we loved it the moment we arrived , why ? i dont know , maybe it reflects the spirit of venice , if you go there you will understand what i'm talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: sgsheep
Reviews.Content: Hotel is near Santa Lucia train station but if you have big bags it would be a hassle to get to because of the bridges that you'll have to cross. The room is a total surprise - we were given #307, which was the attic room and it was so nicely decorated with such a great ambiance complete with windows on the ceiling right above the bed I wished so much that I was with my girlfriend instead of my parents. Downside was that the room is only accessible via 2 flights of stairs, so the porter's help is absolutely necessary. The garden outside the breakfast room was a pleasant surprise too - but while we were there it was just too hot for us to utilise it. Staff was pleasant and helpful; the lady at the breakfast room even remembered our usual order, which was quite rare for a medium-sized hotel like this. Would likely return if I happen to visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pepsi1924
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Venice with Ryanair and travelled by bus into the city, within 5 minutes of getting off the bus we were at the Hotel. We were given a lovely spacious room overlooking the garden, from one aspect and a quiet square on the other side. Reading other reviews of this hotel we requested tea and coffee making facilities. Which was waiting for us after we had been for a short walk. The breakfast was very good and kept well replenished, The hotel is in a great location for getting around, 2 mins walk from the water bus which was always busy but we did manage to get a seat most times, there is also a good supermarket and cash points nearby. Venice is a beautiful place to explore on foot but as it was very hot when we were there we went by boat to see most of the sights. We booked a ticket online which cost one euro to visit the Basillica which saves you having to queue, well worth it. We searched out some reasonable places to eat and enjoyed some really good food, On our last day the hotel manager recommended some places to visit giving us directions and a map. I cant wait to go to Venice again and and we would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied stay”
Reviews.Author: pjthurston
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise. Very clean and neat and a comfy bed. Served a big breakfast in a nice setting. Helpful staff and pleasant garden area. I would stay there again. It is a perfect location as it is close to Piazzale Roma and all the transportation, the train station and the start of the Grand canal is right there. Very good restaurants close by. We were catching our cruise after one night and it was easy to hail a cab and they took us to the ship within a 5 minute drive. I would do this again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT! Much more than you expect of a tourist mecca”
Reviews.Author: blitzen1945
Reviews.Content: Our proposed flight to Italy in May was greatly disrupted by the icelandic eruption, so that we had to change ,and then change again, out l booking dates with Hotel Olimpia.The service and help we received from Roberto Quaglia was exceptional, altering our reservation with no fuss, no additional cost, and with courtesy, humour and professionalism. He even remembered us when we finally arrived and even helped with my blundering efforts at Italian past tenses! This man deserves a medal!!. The Hotel Olimpia, itself, is a delight. For the cost, ( we booked early in the year) it was outstanding. The rooms were interesting and spacious, breakfast was excellent, and the interior garden was a lovely, peaceful surprise. The location, though a good brisk walk from S. Marco, was perfect for us, close to the canals and restaurants, but without the pricetag of hotels closer to S. Marco. We would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for all manners of Travel”
Reviews.Author: vego64
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Olympia for two days before and two days after a cruise. The hotel is right off the Piazzale Roma where the Shuttle Bus from the airport drops you and where the cruise shuttlebuses pick you up. It is also in striking distance of the train and vaporetti station. The rooms are clean and comfortable. By reading the hotel info book I found that face cloths were available from the front desk as was the delivery of a tea and coffee maker with all the necessaries to prepare a hot drink. One word of warning for the "senior" traveler : arrival at the hotel requires dragging your suitcases up a flight of steps and down the other side as you cross a canal to get to the hotel. (Way around this is a private water taxi arranged for at the airport....or a porter to take the luggage at about 10 Euros a piece.) The staff were pleasant, helpful and the breakfast was nicely served and much more than adequate. You can, with little effort, reach all the sights that Venice is known for on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service, super clean and nice size rooms”
Reviews.Author: caseydepot
Reviews.Content: My husband, mom and her significant other traveled to Rome, Florence and Venice this past February. Of the 3 hotels we stayed at, the Hotel Olipmia was by far the best. The rooms were large in comparison to the other places, the decor was charming, the bathroom was big and it was just a fantastic place. And the view from our room...perfecto. The staff were all wonderful, and very helpful My husband and I slept through breakfast both days, but my mom said it was very good. Overall, we highly recommend the Hotel Olimpia to anyone visiting Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; amazing city”
Reviews.Author: TheFinale
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 children stayed at Hotel Olimpia prior to taking a cruise to the Greek islands. We had a 2 room suite located at the very top of the hotel building. It was beautifully decorated in an elegant Venetian style, with very comfortable beds and a spacious bathroom. Although not the cheapest accommodation in Venice, it was worth the little bit extra. The location is about a 20 minute walk to St. Mark's, and ideally placed for access to cruise terminals. I cannot say enough about the very helpful, friendly and excellent service provided by the staff-nothing was too much trouble, and they made our stay in this beautiful city even more special. The breakfast room was lovely, and the breakfast provided was of a high standard. We checked out very reluctantly! I highly recommend this hotel as a great place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - unless you're on the top floor!”
Reviews.Author: blynda9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to joining a cruise in Venice. Very easy to find - we came in from the airport by bus and it's literally 2 minutes walk from Piazzale Roma. Breakfast was good - apart from washing and sleeping we spent no time in the hotel really. However, we'd booked a room via Booking.com which stated we would get a bright airy room with a sofa. We actually got a very small room which barely had room to walk round the bed, no sofa and it was so overheated we had the window open the entire time we were there (and it was pretty cold in Venice at the time too!). No room to store suitcases and we had 2 large ones as we were on a cruise. As we only booked one night, and wanted to go out to explore Venice that afternoon, we only mentioned it that evening and showed them our confirmation stating the room we should have got - hoping to get a reduction. Manager got back to us next morning when we checked our - he was very nice and said we should have asked when we had seen the room - fair enough, so we took it up with Booking.com when we returned from our cruise. Basically, after complaining to them 3 times all they have come up with is an offer of a 30 euros reduction and a bottle of Prosecco on our next visit!. Well, we don't want to go back to Venice so why couldn't they have given us a reduction at the time? Moral - if you book via an agency make sure you actually get what you have paid for.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel in a great location - easy to find and quiet”
Reviews.Author: npjrogers
Reviews.Content: Its location is a very strong feature - near the bus station but also on a Canal. Near where the local eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service in convenient location, but...”
Reviews.Author: KateDen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olimpia for two days following a cruise. The location is on a canal and there are tables in front where you can enjoy your own wine or picnic. The hotel itself is clean and charming and the people at the reception desk are very helpful. Our room overlooked the lovely garden in the back of the hotel and was quiet and quite comfortable. Their breakfast was very nice and there are many restaurants in the area with good food and a view of a canal. We were very happy with everything about the hotel itself. There were many other cruisers staying there and all were pleased with the hotel and the helpfulness of the staff. However, if you have any mobility issues or are carrying a lot of luggage, there are some things to consider. We took a taxi to Piazza Roma, then began the trip to the hotel. Keep in mind that you can see the hotel from the Piazza. And we were aware there was a bridge (the Tre Ponte bridges) in between, in fact we "looked" at it on a map of Venice that allows you to see a 360 degree view and it appeared to have shallow, deep steps. Not. We had four suitcases (two larger, two small) and my husband's folding mobility scooter. It didn't appear from our view of the bridge online that would be too much of a problem, and we planned out how to get everything over. I even asked a porter at the piazza how much they would charge to move it We were quoted 60 euros (for about 75 meters!) and decided to stick to our original plan. That was a big mistake. Fortunately after one trip, a nice Canadian man staying at the hotel helped with the second trip and one of the hotel managers helped with the mobility scooter so we were able to get there. Going back to the airport though, we gratefully paid the 30 euros the hotel negotiated for us to have porters take the stuff back to the Piazza. Moral of story: don't bring more luggage than you can't easily carry over a bridge that is the equivalent of two flights of steps (one up, one down). This was a difficult proposition after a 21 day cruise. And it's best not to bring a mobility scooter to Venice (or anywhere in Europe for that matter) since it will be unusable and will add immensely to your luggage load.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: OrkneySusie
Reviews.Content: We had planned an overnight stay at this hotel following our Cruise. Unfortunately we were one of the millions left stranded following the volcanic ash. Lucky for us we were stuck at this hotel. The staff were absolutely amazing, could not do enough for your, went out of their way to provide anything. Fixed my laptop, helped with train routes anything. The hotel was clean, rooms large, fantastic shower. So handy to everything. Quiet garden to relax in, breakfasts were everything you could want. Could not recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jurizzo
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Breakfast was delicious, the location was the best and the staff very nice. I just didnÂ´t like the separate bed, mas thatÂ´s ok, we were in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for cruisers or first timers in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBender
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here before and after a cruise. The location is great as you can see it from the Piazza Roma where the airport buses drop you. Also the cruiseline (MSC) shuttle stop was right there too. The rooms were quite big with two twins and a queen bed. The breakfast was delightful, with good variety. The room was a little pricey, but this is Venice. The mainland (Tessera) hotels are about half the price, but then you need to take a bus to get to Venice. Great gelato around the corner for 1 Euro, and close to vaporetta stops. We walked to St. Marks and back and it was just so interesting and cool. We would stay here again, especially if a good deal was available.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome return to our hotel in Venice â€“ The Hotel Olimpia”
Reviews.Author: LMTA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Olimpia in March of 2008. Beginning March 12, 2010 we returned to Venice and the Hotel Olimpia for seven nights. It is easy to get to the Hotel from the Bus Terminal or the Santa Lucia Railroad Station.. From the railroad station take the new Ponte Calatrava, serviceable but less traveler-friendly than the bridge should have been, to Piazzale Roma and the bus terminal. Go through the Piazzale to the Hotel Olimpia crossing one more small bridge. No need to lug suitcases onto swaying and expensive vaporettos or water taxis. We previously stayed in Room 142 on the ground floor of the small annex across the hotelâ€™s garden and loved it thoroughly. This time because of repairs being performed in room 142 we settled for room 145, a flight above. This bedroom included a small sitting room overlooking the garden which more than compensated for the flight of stairs. Either 142 or 145 are very nice, quiet and comfortable for us. The breakfasts were fine and the staff and management were quite helpful. We really felt at home here. We warmly recommend the Hotel Olimpia.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, fantastic service. very very clean. ideal for romantic weekend away”
Reviews.Author: m0nkey111
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service Very clean, room service everyday Info for smokers: this hotel has only no smoking rooms Great continental b'fast Very happy with our choice, would definitely visit again. Value for money. No restaurant in the hotel but there are many of restaurants to chose from in the area. Located in a nice and quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: EllanVannin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Carnivale. The hotel is very clean and we were given a well decorated bedroom and modern bathroom, overlooking a small side canal (Room 110). The breakfast was very good with a wide choice of bread, croissants, cakes, cold meats, cheeses, cold boiled eggs, cereals, yoghurt, fruit juice, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. The staff in the breakfast room were very welcoming and efficient. The receptionist was very helpful, and rang a local restaurant to make a booking for dinner for us. I would stay here again in a heart-beat.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Fault It”
Reviews.Author: He_Ted
Reviews.Content: Hotel Olimpia is very clean, and is tastefully decorated in a Venetian style. The staff are very helpful and will provide you with tea, coffee & ice for your room and the desk porter even carries your bags to your room. You can see the hotel form Piazzale Roma although the vehicles cannot be heard and are only just in view. The hotel is perfectly placed for buses, taxi (road or water) and trains. All being less than 5 minutes walk away. The airport buses drop you almost outside your hotel. Our bedroom (Rm 206) was big enough for 2 with an excellent bathroom and shower. The breakfast was of high quality, and you can eat a much as you wish and there is even a lovely sunny garden at the back of the hotel. Getting into Venice couldnâ€™t be easier; turn right and you get to St Markâ€™s square from the west or turn left and you go via the Rialto Bridge and approach from the north and east. We paid 40 euros per room per night B&B booking with hotels4u.com. David and Wendy

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: chinkynorthofengland
Reviews.Content: just had 4 ntights in this hotel and what a great place to stay. First of all dont let it put you off being near piaza roma, this is a plus point in many ways. Firstly when you arrive you have not far to go to get to the hotel and on your departure it is easy for the bus or train station whilst still being on one of the small canals. Also it is near the universaty so it is cheap for food and drinks. There are some great little bars nearby and at 1.20e for a glass of good wine in nice stemwear you cant go wrong. We stayed near san marco 5 years ago and paid 2e for a glass of wine then. Also some hotels are very difficult to find even after you have been there a few days you can still get lost but staying at the olimpia this was not a problem. The staff are friendly and proffesional and go out of there way to help you. Our room was overlooking the canal room 110 on the first floor, it was a very nice room spacious and very clean and nicely decorated. As the weather was cold it was nice to go back at the end of the day to a nice warm room and plenty of hot water. Breakfast was very nice lots of choice in a very nice little dining room. There was a lovely garden at the back of the hotel if you go in the warmer weather its a nice place to relax. If i return to venice again i would deffinately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: al_gupta
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel after reading some positive reviews, and I was not disappointed! The hotel is very close to the station - only about 10 minutes walk. And it didn't take time finding it - one can easily see it from the bus stand (Piazza le Roma). The hotel has a very charming air about it - the whole decor has the old world Venetian beauty about it. The room was also a pleasant surprise. After having stayed in small rooms in good hotels in Italy, we were very happy to see the spacious room and the spacious bathroom with it. I had requested for a room overlooking the canal - and thats what we got, despite it being the new year season ! The room had a cosy bed, a minibar, a TV, a large cupboard. The service of the staff was excellent ! After the efficient check-in, the staff carried our luggage to the room. A tea/coffee tray was sent us within minutes of asking. The breakfast was good, and the breakfast room overlooks a garden on one side, and the canal on the other. All-all-in, its a nice cosy place for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: CatEire
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location, positioned away from the most touristy and therefore expensive areas, while being close to Santa Lucia station which connects to the mainland via train. It is also a five minute walk or less to bus connections to Treviso airport which makes it a great choice for the Ryanair traveller. There is a water bus stop within few minutes walk which connects you to all the majors stops on the grand canal. The room was on the small side but decorated in typical Venetian design with lovely quaint touches throughout. The staff were effecient and helpful. The breakfast was very good for a continential and served in a lovely breakfast roon overlooking a canal. Overall a very clean and well priced hotel bursting with old style Venetian charm.

Reviews.Title: “very careful service”
Reviews.Author: egh1209
Reviews.Content: During our stay in Venice I took a wrong step into the canal taxi and needed medical help. The hotel took good care of me and helped me in making contact with my insurance. The location is exellent while you're very near all the public transport lines into and from Venice. The hotel meanwhile, is pleasant and quiet inside. Fam.Ghezzi

Reviews.Title: “Nice conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: clipperPa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights prior to our cruise, the hotel is very conveniently located transportation wise from the airport and pier. The staff at the hotel was very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was very good. The only note is that the shower was actually smaller than the one on the ship. Great hotel, I would stay there again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ShobanaMahesh
Reviews.Content: very good location and easy to access train, cruise and even buses to airport starting from morning 4.40am. Venice u can jus walk and explore and good water bus service. Lifts and rooms are small but it is nice hotel with good dÃ©cor. If u are going to spend time in roaming Venice so it is best place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: magicmarker48
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quietly situated, although well located for the trains, buses and vaporetto. It is very clean and comfortable with friendly and efficient staff. Excellent selection for breakfast. I developed a health problem whilst in Venice and the reception staff could not have been more helpful and supportive in assisting me to resolve the matter. I would certainly stay at this hotel if we return to Venice. Our only criticism would be that the room was a little on the small side but as we spent a great deal of time sightseeing it did not affect our enjoyment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: midget53
Reviews.Content: This is belated, but I must say this hotel was in a good location and was a very pleasant stay. Our room was very nice and the hotel staff was most helpful. We stayed one night before meeting up with our cruise ship and we were able to get the shuttle to the port in the piazza nearby. Also, the continental breakfast offered was lovely and you could dine inside or out. I would recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very perfect spot..”
Reviews.Author: helio48
Reviews.Content: Found this location through my sister/travel agent..Loved it.So easy to reach from Airport one ACVO ride 3 Euros..Do not take a taxi..not needed and pouf you are there...!...Pack lightly for lugging over bridges.Excellent reception staff..friendly and knowledgeable.Had a great rate for travel agents..Delightful setting and breakfast.Will absolutely go back and reccommend it to anyone spending time or traveling through Venice.Accessible to Vaporettas .Olimpia is the name to ask for..They had no idea about The Best Western part....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, little pricey for cruisers.”
Reviews.Author: CaliopeC
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and reviews, and we were not disappointed. It was one bridge away from the Piazzale Roma which is the convergence point for land transportation. The staff was very friendly and spoke English, though we did attempt to communicate in Italian as much as possible. We were early and they allowed us to leave our luggage while they prepared our rooms (prior to standard check-in time). We grabbed a caffe' and a snack and came back to check in. The room was not what you'd expect in the states, but by Venice standards I thought it was a pretty good size. It was clean and comfortable, and we were pleased with the accommodations. They had a nice breakfast room, and courtyard with outdoor dining which we utilized the following morning. The only con I found was that it seemed the price was increased for the cruise demand. We came in a day early for our cruise as I'm sure many people did, and for that day the rate was two times as much as the following day, after the ships had sailed. We paid almost the same for our one night in Venice prior to the cruise departure as we did for all four nights in Rome after our return. Still, if I were to return to Venice, I would definitely consider this staying at this hotel again, and will definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: xpis3
Reviews.Content: As a matter of fact it was the second time that I tayes in this hotel. The first one was in 2001 when it was under previous owners and another name. I choose it now because of its location, near Piazzale Roma. From there you can go everywhere in Venezia and around. The staff is very helpful, the breadfast good. All in all we were very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel-great value for money”
Reviews.Author: HappyHolts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed every minute. It is in a great location- close to some lovely restaurants and it is a wonderful walk from the hotel to St Marks. Every morning we had our breakfast in the lovely garden and the waiters were very attentive. All the staff were very helpful and kind. The rooms are pretty and clean and to be honest you wont be spending a lot of time in them!!! There is even a mosquito plug so don't worry about them. Yes the showers are not the best but intelligent people will understand why??? They do the job!! This is a real gem of a hotel and if you are on a budget it is a great place to stay. I will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend the Olimpia!”
Reviews.Author: UpstateNYGrace
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a cruise. It's location is perfect...not too far from the cruise terminal and just across a canal from the bus area. The train station is nearby and so is transportation on the Grand Canal. We found this hotel to be clean, the breakfast was included. The rooms were not too small and we could easily open the shutters and windows and hear the sounds of the city. Even though it was near the bus area, it was not noisy. It was not difficult at all to find our way to St. Mark's (signs clearly marked the way) and on the way we were able to see and experience the real Venice. We passed through a small square where vendors had set up to sell their wares,,, including a stand selling fish! In one of the small canals, was a boat where the owners were selling fruits and vegetables. The Grand Canal is just steps from the hotel. We enjoyed strolling the area nearby...several shops and restaurants. This is a perfect location..near transportation but away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas. We would stay here again if we ever come back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Venice”
Reviews.Author: stefanotour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated very close to the parking garage and entrance to Venice. The rooms were well appointed and generous in size. A beautiful garden and generous breakfast. Staff cvould not hasve been more helpful in every respect. Very quiet. Only problem was internet access which was limited to a cumbersome lobby computer.We were advised thsat wi-fi would be available Jan 2010 in all rooms. Only problem was the lack of details on the web site as to how to find the hotel. Just cross the bus parking lot -no need to go over large bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet location - would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: vintagebutterfly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Best Western Olympia for 3 nights in Nov 09 and experienced a pleasant stay. The hotel is situated very close to the coach park Piazzale Roma but is far enough back that noise was never a problem and the scenery still beautiful. Get a good map to find it (we used Rough Guides). It's not hidden away but you will soon learn that the streets and canals of Venice all look the same and one can easily find themselves lost (this is part of the charm though). The location is away from most of the tourist hot spots meaning you miss the crowds! If like us you're on a budget, you're very near the student quarter here - Campo Santa Margherita is a great place for bars and cheap eateries. Yes you will have to carry luggage over a couple of small bridges - you would have to do this anywhere in Venice! So really complaints about this are ridiculous and do not reflect the hotel. If mobility is a problem for you make sure you prearrange luggage details with your hotel. The room we had was a standard double and although fairly small, the room was adequate with a good sized bathroom and was clean and tidy when we arrived. Cleaning was discreet and thorough each day. Breakfast was included and the usual continental affair, but remember to ask for milk if you want it with your tea or coffee, it is not standard in Italy. The staff were friendly and helpful, speaking good english, but you can see they appreciate it when you make an effort to speak a few words in Italian, even if you get it hopelessly wrong! One point however is the wifi which is advertised in the information booklet in your room wasnt infact available and the hotel tried to persuade us to pay 5 euros for 30mins on their computers in the lobby - we didnt bother, there are much cheaper internet cafes around venice (look them up before you go!). A point on the lift - yes it was tiny and could only just fit two of us in. If this bothers you, dont go to Venice, most hotels have tiny lifts, they are working with existing very old architecture! Venice is expensive, very expensive. What you get for Â£100 a night in Venice is not nearly as special (in terms of hotel quality) than you'd get elsewhere, but the city itself more than makes up for it with charm.

Reviews.Title: “No Porters???”
Reviews.Author: CalGirlTravler
Reviews.Content: We drug our luggage to the steps that lead over a canal. My friend stayed with the luggage while I attempted to get someone from the hotel to help. I asked the woman behind the front desk and she stated nobody from the hotel was allowed to go out to help. I brought the first two pieces to the lobby and then went back to help my friend. When we checked out the next day, the hotel was able to provide us with a porter at 8 Euros a bag. I couldn't believe it!!!!! By the way, the elevator was almost comical. It was so small that only 1 person and 1 large bag can ride at one time.

Reviews.Title: “Single occupation problem!”
Reviews.Author: jmatcham
Reviews.Content: Yes, I would recommend this hotel UNLESS you want single occupation. They have three rooms for single occupation (although doubles don't cost much more) and two of them have 'no view' meaning they have a 'window' looking onto a space as big and miserable looking as a lift shaft. I travelled with a friend and (at over Â£100 a night) we had instant 'words' with the manager. I speak Italian reasonably well so this did not disconcert me and after the usual 'we can't do anything about it' stuff, I was vocal enough (and threatened them with the internet!) that they did agree to change my friends room after the second night. BUT that being said all the staff were friendly and helpful. The situation is good for transport and arrival and departure, and there is a pleasant cafe along the canal outside. Given that theSt Marks Square area is incredibly crowded, to the point of being unpleasant, I thought the location a good one. Also there is a very pleasant garden at the back where weather permitting (it was!) one can have breakfast. As with everywhere in Venice eating out is a pain unless you are rich. Watch out for additional charges...cover 2 euros...service 12.5% sort of thing. Some places advertise 'no extra charges'. Fish is good. The only single room there that is nice is the one I had no.111 for the record!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: LauraW5661
Reviews.Content: Great little place. Took a while to find, but was lovely and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - great location - reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: UK1000
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Venice for a 4 night city break. We chose this hotel for its location and because it was reasonably priced. We flew into Marco Polo airport and got a 3euro bus ticket each for a direct bus into the bus station in Venice. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the bus station so was great, as we got there mid-afternoon, checked-in and had the afternoon to explore Venice. We stayed in room 131 (on the groundfloor, overlooking the garden). It was lovely and quiet and there was no noise (either from from the hotel or boats outside). The room itself wasn't big (but then for Venice, and the price we paid we didn't expect it to be big!). The bathroom (shower only) was modern and clean. The continental breakfast was good. One morning when the weather was sunny, we sat in the garden and had our breakfast which was lovely. This hotel was perfect for us. We were able to walk or get the boat to all the places we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “There are many choices in hotels -service at Olympia sets them apart”
Reviews.Author: dafish28
Reviews.Content: I have waited 30 days since our 5 night stay in mid September to post this review, to make certain my feelings had not diminished over time. Hotel Olympia is a small boutique establishment, well run under the watchful eye of SimoneTiengo, Owner. It is the management team that makes this charming little jewel unique. Director Roberto went out of his way to make our stay memorable, along with his able assistant Irena on the day shift and Serena and Andrea on the night shift. We had requested a room overlooking the small garden terrace and were pleased to have been given room 211 which had three windows which opened onto this beautiful quiet area. Morning breakfast was served in a series of small dining rooms or outside on the terrace, by either Fabio, who was always smiling and eager to please or Enrico Rossi, who made expresso coffee so wonderful the memory brings a tear to my eye still.!! Last but not least, the bellhop Mazu was the hardest working guy in the place, always moving to help with bags, clear the tables or sweep the garden path. This hotel is simply perfect for cruise dock convenience and/or bus plaza connections as it is only a short walk to both and but a slightly longer walk to the train station as well, making it ideal for those arriving or departing by either means. I have stayed in BW hotels all over Europe and Olympia is one of the best for service and convenience and friendly staff that make you feel at home. We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “easy access and confortable”
Reviews.Author: cockrel42
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located just a small walk from the railway , bus and vaporetto stations...but far enough to avoid noise..

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: mft75
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in june. Good location, easily access from train station. Room was a very nice garden view. Quiet and clean. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location (near the train station) & Price”
Reviews.Author: pchen0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Best Western Olimpia for 2 nights in Venice. The hotel is "antique" so don't expect it to be a modern hotel. I chose this hotel primarily for the location (walking distance to the train station - about a 10-minute walk) so that I would not have to take the water taxi. The breakfast is adequate (continental breakfast) and make sure you ask for capuccino or expresso.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in a Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sottycat
Reviews.Content: Hotel Olimpia is a charming hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful, the public and bedroom was very clean and nicely furnished. A excellent breakfast with so much choice. I enjoyed the quiet of the garden. All in all I could not fault this hotel and I have stayed in many on my travels. When I return to venice I will be staying at the Hotel Olimpia.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: FlorenceMilfordHaven
Reviews.Content: A 3 euro ticket from the airport takes you to Plaza da Roma in 15 mins, you can see the hotel as you get off the bus, A 2 minute walk up steps along small bridge and down steps brings you to Hotel Olimpia. We arrived at Marco Polo at 9p.m by 10p.m we had checked in and were eating supper overlooking canal by hotel-magical.Rooms very pretty, not big, but comfortable.Breakfast plentiful. Very convenient for leaving luggage there when checking out.Would definetly stay there again, not cheap though.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: jaybLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Olimpia for 5 days. It was easy to find, extremely clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a good continental breakfast. The room and its bathroom were nice too-a good find i na nextremely expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location to explore Venice”
Reviews.Author: cardlife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights beofre boarding on a cruise. Nice relaitevely small hotel with ideal location very close to the Piazzale Roma where busus from Marco Polo and Trvision ariport stop. Also wtaerbus stop at hand. Nice and quit rooms in Venetiaon style. Not to big, but adequate. Nice garden for (good) breakfast and leisure. Get a discount by booking in advance. Value for money as hotels in venice centre are relatively expensive. Beware: Google maps locatin is a bit off. Just go to the nearest bridge from Piazz. Roma and you see the hotel, nicely situated along a small canal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: retiredteachers2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise and found it to be an excellent location. Our room was clean and the breakfast was very good, with several items on the buffet. We would highly recommend it. Venice is an expensive place, but this location was exactly what we needed. It was easily located after we got off the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Intro to Venice”
Reviews.Author: canadian22
Reviews.Content: After 24 hours of travelling we arrived at P. Roma. We walked a few yards and down our first set of steps to find Venice (canals, bridges, boats and old buildings) stretched out in front of us. Hotel Olimpia was directly across the canel and required traversing only two more sets of steps to reach it. For Venice this rated as a miracle. Our first impression was that the building was old and a little run down. Once we opened the door any negative impressions disappeared. The entire building was decorated in ornate Venitian style without appearing tacky. The elevator was the tiniest we've ever seen but it worked. The room was beautiful, with two windows overlooking the courtyard. The bathroom was wonderful and the beds comfy. Breakfast was everything we required. The staff were all friendly and extremely helpful. To have such a great place to stay, in such an excellent location gave our holiday a terrific start. This was an excellent hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Rhisibabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night following a cruise. The hotel was perfectly located right by Piazzale Roma where the bus station is located and a major stop for vaporettas at the bottom of the Grand Canal. The room was beautiful with padded material instead of wallpaper. The lift is the smallest I have ever seen - just big enough for 3 people - my children loved this. The staff were extremely helpful. Breakfast was adequate and can be eaten in the garden if wanted. Overall this was the perfect hotel to stay in at the end of the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, recommend it”
Reviews.Author: cruiserCyprus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights after our cruise. Hotel's location is very good. Cruises offer free shuttles to Piazzale Roma, and Hotel Olimpia is very close to Piazzale Roma. You just need to cross over a bridge with your luggage to reach the hotel. The hotel has a nice little garden where you can have your breakfast or sun bathe. Our room had a canal view, it was very nice. The area was also very clean and quiet with nice restaurants around. You can take a varopetto to San Marco, but we chose to walk and discover the narrow streets on the way. You can reach San Marco in about half an hour. I recommend this hotel to people staying in Venice before or after their cruise trips.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyc_t08
Reviews.Content: This is a VERY VERY BAD hotel. Please do not go by the ga ga reviews. This hotel is atrocious. It is a dinky motel. Rooms are horrible and really old and dilapidated. We paid 250+ dollars and trust me it is highway robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes the difference at Hotel Olimpia”
Reviews.Author: SteveDCUSA
Reviews.Content: Okay, if you want a four star hotel then pay for it. Yes, you will get more room and a full service restuarant. If you want a perfectly good three star hotel in Venice, Italy, then consider the Hotel Olimpia. It is extremely well located ( block from the train station) and run by customer sensitive hotel staff who actually remember who you are. -Steve M

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - convenient for cruise port, airport and vaparetto”
Reviews.Author: rayzel
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early because of an overnight flight.
