It was inexpensive to get here from the airport - we simply took the bus from the airport to Piazzele Roma for 3E per person. You can see the hotel from there, but there is a bridge with a good number of steps that you must cross. If you have lots of luggage like us, that is a bit of a pain, but the convenience and price outweighed that problem. The hotel has a small lobby and is decorated in an old world style. The elevator can only hold one person and two suitcases, so we had to make a couple of trips. Our room was not ready, but the charming desk clerk gladly stored our luggage while we explored the city. Like the lobby, the room was quite small, much like a smaller cruise ship cabin. It too, was decorated in a charming fashion. However, the bathroom also went along with the room in size. My husband could barely turn around in the shower. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Our room faced the charming garden behind the hotel. Breakfast was included in our rate, but Internet access was not included. There was a somewhat steep charge for that. The breakfast consisted of cold foods of various sorts, but it was fine for our needs. The hotel is not right at the major tourist spots, but Rialto and St. Mark's were each less than a 20-30 minute walk. The best part of the location was that were were just across from Piazelle Roma and that gave us access to the vaporetto station there. We had purchased a multi-day vaporetto pass and we used to get everywhere in Venice as well as to Murano and Burano. If a large room is not a problem and you need a reasonably priced hotel, convenient location for the vaporettos and the airport, this is a perfect hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: Mebsy
Reviews.Content: Good position, just over bridge from bus station. nice clean rooms with nice view of garden. Breakfast had nice variety. Lift as less able and room for my wheelchair. Staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Met our Budget”
Reviews.Author: rugermasters
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on here and seeing the photo's my expectations were very high of Hotel Olimpia. The location couldn't be better if you get the bus/coach from Marco Polo airport, and the location for getting around venice is also very good. Unfortunately I didn't find the rooms as nice as described and the hotel is very basically decorated, don't let that put you off. If your on a budget then this hotel will be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in good location for public transport”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaDevon
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel situated near the Piazzale Roma, so great for transport links. I was not happy with the first room that I was given as it was not in the main building but the one next door. The man on reception gave me a different room and was very charming about it. All the staff were very helpful. The hotel has a lovely garden.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Berkshiregal56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located by the train station and the vaparetto station. The room and bathroom was beautiful and very comfortable. While it's not located close to the main attractions, we thoroughyly enjoyed the hotel's garden and there were a number of decent resautants and trattorias very close by. The staff was extemely helpful with everything. We only stayed for 2 nights. I was very disappointed, because I could have stayed there for the entire time of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel. Nice value in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Brazucanomundo
Reviews.Content: Confortable rooms and very clean. Venetian style. Excellent staff. Although not in central touristic triangle, very well located, easy to go from/to airport (close Piazzale Roma) and near Vaporetto Line 1 (Grand Canal). Nice to walk to St Marco. Good breakfast, but not special. Perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Jasonm921
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right by the main Piazza Roma so if coming by plane or train...you won't have to drag your luggage very far. The vaporetto was only a 5 minute walk (make sure you buy the unlimited ride pass) and it took a 20-30 minute to St. Mark's Square. There are restaurants near by but we ate by the Rialto Bridge and were surprised how affordable it was in relation to the fact that we are eating 50 feet from a worldwide landmark (the Euro has gone up in the past month so that might have changed). The hotel was old...but so is everything else. Two twins pushed together to form a queen size bed. The breakfast was fantastic. The coffee was amazing. I really enjoyed this hotel and thanks to Tripadvisor for steering me toward it. If you want to see more of my pics from Venice see www.flickr.com/photos/easygoer

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Ramundo
Reviews.Content: This facility and its staff is excellent. Clean, attractive and convenient. Breakfast is excellent. Assistance with touring, questions, and needs are always met with understanding and knowledge. Many good restaurants are close by. Reasonable rates for the value of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this sweet hotel”
Reviews.Author: 433Chelsea
Reviews.Content: Great staff Great Location Charming location Very easy to get to from bus and train terminals! Would recommend to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Romance and Comfort Near the Canals”
Reviews.Author: CityTraveler77
Reviews.Content: There are only 2 rooms on the top floor of this hotel (the 5th floor) and it was like staying in a romantic attic. Sloped wooden roof, shutters that opened up with a spectacular view of the Venetian rooftops and canals, and a floral motif on the furniture and walls. The rooms are tiny, yet quite clean and equipped with all of the basics. The staff was incredibly helpful in finding restaurants and attractions--especially given the fact that most people trek through Venice with a map in hand! A wonderful, and comfortable option for a Venetian visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely gem in good location”
Reviews.Author: loll1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Olimpia as we heard it was convenient for the Cruise Terminal. We were a bit worried as we had not travelled independently before, but it turned out to be so easy, and immediately getting off the coach from the airport the Hotel was in front of us. After our stay there was also a free shuttle bus to the port. The hotel staff were extremely helpful, even allowing us to park our suitcases back at the hotel after the cruise rather than booking them into a left luggage office. They had a lovely tranquil garden if you need to escape from the hubbub of Venice on a busy day. The morning breakfast was also very good, with lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Howardjay
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews of this hotel were solid but didn't prepare us for the terrific experience we had there. The front desk was always wonderful, the room was fantastic and the breakfast couldn't have been better. Our room was in the annex across the courtyard and it was ideal-roomy, clean and with a fabulous bathroom with a huge and comfortable bathtub. The location was perfect for us because we arrived at the Piazza Roma by bus from the airport. The hotel is no more than 100 yards from the bus stop-you can actually see it from there but the hotel is isolated so the Piazza Roma is not noticable in any negative way. The walk to and from the hotel to all the sights is wonderful and fascinating. The only negative was that they charged a lot for internet access. This is a great place if you don't need to be in the epicenter of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: johnnytipp
Reviews.Content: we just stayed in this hotel from from monday to friday of easter week and we were delighted with everything. staff were all very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english. if you are staying here do not think of getting private transport from airports, the bus stops at piazzala roma are 2 minutes walk and only step over one small bridge - no trouble at all. 5 minutes to train station. main vaporetto stop 5 minutes too. breakfast was good and fresh and plentiful. rooms a good size and very clean. all main areas are easily accessed by walking or vaporetto(water bus). my only complaint would be that the computer in the lobby for guests to access internet was very slow. this is a great hotel from which to explore both tourist and real venice we would definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mbagirl4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and quaint. My husband and I enjoyed the hotel. The staff was nice and very helpful. My only negative about this hotel is that it only had CNN. We were barely in the room, but when I had trouble sleeping watching a nice english movie or show would have put me right to sleep. We loved Venice and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: broomhilda04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Olimpia for 4 nights in March and were pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was. The bus station is literally across the canal as well as the water taxis. There was one bridge to cross in order to get to the hotel from the bus, but it was manageable, at least with one suitcase and a shoulder bag. The elevator at the hotel is extremely small, max 2 people I think, but it's never so crowded that you had to wait long. I personally perferred the steps, but after a long day of walking, the elevator did look inviting. The breakfast was nice too. Just like the other reviewer said, there were different types of cereal, meats, cheeses, boiled eggs, fruit, a really good crossiant and a fantastic cappuccino. It's a nice way to start your day off. We did eat at the restaurant next door and the one around the corner and found that they were really good. We didn't have any bad experiences with the restaurants near the hotel. We had read in a lot of reviews to eat off the beaten path as some of the tourist areas can get quite pricey, however, we did find a little place near the Rialto Bridge, don't know the name and couldn't find it again if my life depended on it, but the price was VERY expensive for a toasted pizza bread type thing. It was 15 euros. That's as much or maybe more than what we paid for a dinner. Not to mention it was probably the worst thing we ate on our entire trip. We thought it looked so good through the window we never bothered to check the price. Our fault, but lesson learned. But the Olimpia is a decent stay for your money. We had a little flat screen tv which did have a CNN Europe channel in English. The bathroom was nice sized but the shower was kinda little. It was a nice surprise to find in the bathroom an outlet that would take a 110 v without a converter/adapter. The room has a little frig stocked with drinks, but we found a little grocery store by the water taxis and bought some drinks and snacks to keep in our room. We did use the computer for 5 euros for 30 minutes, but the computer was slow compared to what we were used to and did lock up on us. But it was really just to do a quick check for something, we were so busy in Venice that the computer wasn't really a concern. If your looking for a 5 star hotel by US standards, I would say you may want to look further. However, if your looking for a good location, friendly staff and clean comfortable accomodations, then I think you would be pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great find from Gate 1 Travel!”
Reviews.Author: AustinGirl500
Reviews.Content: Gate 1 Travel booked us into the Hotel Olimpia in Venice during our multi-city rail trip of Italy, and it was the perfect accommodation for the final leg of our trip. The hotel was the smallest we'd stayed in, but the rooms were still a nice size and immaculately decorated. I still dream about those lovely Murano glass chandeliers. The entire hotel was adorable, and the breakfast, both the room and the food, made for a great start to the day. Hotel Olimpia is located just across from both the bus and train stations so it's very easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, hope to return”
Reviews.Author: redheadedwoman
Reviews.Content: The Olimpia is a great little hotel with a very convenient location. We felt the room was pretty, as was the hotel in general. Great bathroom, plenty of water pressure and hot water in the morning. Breakfast was great, with more than an adequate supply of pastries, rolls, cheese & meats, cereals, yogurts, etc. offered. There was a hot breakfast menu on the table, but we never tried it. As another reviewer noted, excellent coffee! We also really appreciated the helpful and friendly staff, especially Francisco(I am probably getting his name wrong, so sorry) and Mirco, who answered all of our questions and helped me when one of my bags went missing courtesy of the airline.

Reviews.Title: “Best for russians”
Reviews.Author: mirkopolo
Reviews.Content: There are three important reasons why I reccomend this hotel; Firstly , because it takes only five minutes to get the rail way station, bus station and a boat station from the hotel. Remember - in the center of Venice you can use only ONE TRANSPORT - your FOOTs! Secondly, In Venice exists three types of sihgns which helps you to find the three most important destinations; Per Rialto( the bridge), Per San Marko (the square) and Per Ferrova or Piazzale Roma (train station). This sihgns you could see everywhere and the last two always will show the way to the hotel Olimpia. Especcially at the night time! You have to know - the orientiering even with the map is very difficult, because you can not see all the bridges on it and all the time you reach the water at the end of the streets! And the third reason is the hotel personal. There works one guy Mirco. He speaks english, spanish, french, german and russian. By the way, he is very well educated person and pays a lot attention to all your demands - that happends in Italy very very seldom! The director is a very kind and friendly person as well. Be sure, they help you to find out all your problems. Beside this hotel demonstraits a TV programm about history of Venice on several languages. It helps you much to realise where you really are now! Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: samosa123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty easy to find from the train station. We found it difficult to carry our luggage across the stairs over the bridge but they say to pack light when in Venice (and we obviously didn't listen). The room was nice (italian tacky decor :) with a large bathroom with bathtub, flat screen tv, minibar--normal hotel you would find in north america etc. Much better than the other two hotels we stayed at. BUT the one thing that bothered me was this smell. It was this strong floral/toilette odor...it drove me insane! It mostly came from the bathroom and I literally had to hold my breath or even spray perfume to mask it before I went in there cause it was not pleasant and it was so over bearing. U could smell it around the hotel and it was just too strong. The breakfast was fantastic--fresh fruit, cereals, eggs, cappincino, brie cheese, ham, croissants, nutella, cream cheese etc (the best we had in rome compared to our other hotels). We were able to easily get a water taxi near by and go to the main sites such as the rialto bridge and st marks square. By this time we were so sick of italian food so we were grateful to find a falafel place near by (near their university area). A grocery store was also in walking distance so we were able to get food and store it in our minibar. Do yourself a favor and take some food from the breakfast buffet for snacks :) cause everything is so expensive. THey did have wifi in the building so we were able to use our laptop in our room ( we were on the 2nd floor). We were overall pleased with the service--u really noticed difference in service of this american chain versus the other hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service left bad taste”
Reviews.Author: kank15
Reviews.Content: Hotel Olimpia was in a good location as far as it is close to the train station and you won't have to haul your luggage all over Venice. The hotel was going through some renovations when we were there, so it was a maze to get to our room. Our room was clean and the breakfast that was included was decent. What left us upset about our stay was the lack of help and communication from the hotel staff. When we checked in, we explained how we had an early morning flight and asked the best way to get to the airport. They suggested a bus, however it wasn't going to be running early enough; therefore, they said they would call us a taxi. The next night, when we got back to the hotel in the evening (approx. 10:30 pm), they said it was too late to call a taxi and we'd have to take the bus. When we checked out in the morning at 4 am, we were on our own on finding transportation to get us there in time. Luckily, we found a local guy to help us out. We were so upset at the hotel for not explaining to us that we had a time cut-off for ordering a taxi. We felt this was important information they should have told us when we originally inquired about the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: andychem18
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in a great location. the hotel is only 5 mins walk from the train station over the new bridge and is even closer to the bus station (not that you will notice it from the hotel). this means that you don't have to drag your luggage through the narrow streets or on and off water buses to get to the hotel a big plus. our room was excellent (132) it was on the ground floor with a view to the garden which meant that it was very quite. we had a bouble bed (and a bonus single as well not that we needed it). there was a lcd tv with italian, german and english channels and a room safe. the bathroom was very nice, it even had a bath in it although it was a bit small, but it did have a shower over it. if you want tea or coffee making equipment then just ask for it and they bring you it. the breakfast was very good tea, coffee, cereals. bread, cheese, meat etc. with hot food to order. As i said the location is excellent, you cann walk to san marco in about 20 minutes through streets that are off the tourist route. yet if you want to go down the grand canal the water bus stop is only a few minutes away. plus the hotel is nice and quite unlike some near san marco. this means that when you have had enough of the crowds and noise you can retreat to your hotel and recharge ready to return to the streets refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Lahlumdi
Reviews.Content: This is the ideal place to stay if you are going on a cruise out of Venice. It's also great if you are getting into the city from the ATVO shuttle bus from the airport, because it is only a short block from the bus terminal. And as for the cruise, if you are taking a Costa cruise, they have a shuttle from the bus parking lot to the Cost Cruise terminal. Very convenient. Also, you are a stoneâ€™s throw from the Vaporetto stop that begins for the Grand Canal. So it is a great launching point for exploring Venice. It also has a very attractive canal near it, and decent restaurants. It is reasonably priced. Remember that hotels in Venice will be expensive because of the limitation of land, and being a major metropolitan city. The breakfast is excellent. The eating area is attractive. The food is fresh and lovely. Pastries, fresh fruit, cheese and meat, yoghurt, and the fabulous coffee of Italy. The hotel front desk staff is friendly and helpful. We booked an internet rate for a basic room. Since it was off-season, I am certain they upgraded us to a better room, as our room was quite large and overlooked the canal. We were pleased with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal - Convenient Location Close to Bus Terminal”
Reviews.Author: JamieNYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just across a canal from the south-east corner of Piazzale Roma, where buses arrive from and leave to the airport. The hotel is also less than a ten minute walk, and easy to reach, from the train station. That's a good thing if this is your first trip to Venice as finding your way through some parts of the city can be confusing at first. We arrived at around 10:30 AM, and they had a room ready for us. The only problem was that the room was quite small and, to get to it, we had take the elevator to one floor, walk to the end of a hallway, through a door and then down a flight of stairs to a separate wing of the place. There are only a few rooms in this section, so that probably won't be your problem. When I saw other rooms in the main wing through open doors as I walked past, they were obviously much larger than ours. And even though our room was small, it was very clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom newly renovated, and we were still very happy with our stay. The breakfast buffet had breads, cold cuts, cheeses, yogurt, cereal, fruits, and boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find!”
Reviews.Author: eryri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olimpia for a two night break. Arriving late and tired after our flight was diverted to Brescia because of fog at Trevisio, we were given a nice welcome and the best room in the hotel -No 307- the suite! These is no need to visit the Doge's Palace if staying in this room- it is beautifully decorated and clean! The Hotel is very convient for all transport links and within easy reach of all the well known and hidden sights of Venice. One of the nice things about staying in Venice is the lack of traffic noise and this hotel is no exception. Right outside the hotel is a quiet canal and there is a nice walled garden where you can relax. The breakfast provided is excellent and sets you up for the day. You will have a great stay at the Olimpia.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeRocket
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, small but comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance to the train station (go to the right over the new bridge when leaving the station) The hotel is located on a small side canal and our room was on the front with the windows opening up over the canal (great view) Directly accross from the hotel and canal is the main bus terminal parking lot. Some reviews I read said that the noise would be a problem but we didnt have a probelm. It was nice on the morning we left to walk over and catch a bus to the airport. It is a short walk to most anywhere and the water buses are very close. Our room was nice with a flat screen TV, comfortable bed and the bathroom was rather large but the shower was very small. (don't drop the soap, as you have trouble bending over to pick it up.) The hotel clerk fixed me up with free wireless internet during our stay though you can access the net through a computer in the lobby for a fee. The free breakfast was good and contain a fairly large selection. The staff was nice and very patient. All the desk help spoke english. The hotel extends into another building across the courtyard in the back but request a room in the mian building, on front, if possible. There are a couple of nice and reasonable restaurants located right around the corner. All in all, we would stay here again.
